It was at Joe's that we realized the plan for eating out in downtown Gilbert is to have a snack before you leave the house so you're ready for any impending waits.

Probably my favorite place ever to eat. Everything I have had off the menu here is just top notch. My favorite is the two meat plate with pulled pork and hot links. They have classic baked Mac n cheese with the crust on top, and their baked beans are just like my grandma used to make. They even brew their own root beer and cream soda, which is fantastic! While it's a cafeteria style dining room, it also has a lot of charm, bringing to mind a 1950s farmhouse. Nice outdoor area with lots of big trees for shade too.

omg... their bbq sauce is soooooo good here and i love how the meat just falls off the bone.

i'd come back here for the apple pie dessert though. that's just crack to me. i'm addicted
Excellent bbq, I consider myself a expert as I lived in Kansas City for 4 years. You will love it.

Joe's is a Gilbert staple. They have the service down to a science so you can start your journey standing in the back of a line that is about a quarter mile long, and inside of 5 minutes you are sitting at a picnic table under the trees enjoying your grub.

I have been a fan since before I knew why it was important to find and keep places like this thriving.  Joe is cool, and a guy that people who want to succeed in independant business in Arizona should keep their eye on. 

The food is quality, the location has been around forever, but keeps fresh with awesome and unique decor (like a life size tractor) and lots of space outside for families with kids to go crazy.

The menu is simple and doesn't try to do too much. The staff is usually very pleasant as well. 

My usual is that potato that is as big as my forearm stuffed to the gills with pulled pork, sour cream, chives, bbq sauce, butter, cheese. 

and pickles on the side. 

If you haven't been to Joe's, you should make it a point.
This has got to be the best BBQUE since I left Texas. It is a place you have to try. I will drive across town just to get some great food.

I'll keep this simple - we ordered 2 sampler plates, and all the meats were very dry (brisket, chicken, ribs, and pulled pork).  I could say we were bbq aficionados from Austin to try and make this review more relevant, but when the meat is this dry - it doesn't take a bbq snob to know this place stinks.

I did think the sides were okay (mac and cheese, cheesy potatoes, apple crisp), but we came for bbq.

Good ol BBQ spot that's not a chain.

Cafeteria type ordering place with plenty of seating. 

Have loads of meats including turkey. Can be bought by the pound as well. Lots of sides and very good root beer on tap.

Best thing i would say is the ribs. Their BBQ sauce is also good.

Ribs were good, chicken was good, mac n cheese was a joke, and bread was not good. Tried the "homemade root beer" that was 2.29, Not Good! Actually traded it for something else. My daughter tried the bbq sandwich. She couldn't eat it. We were Very disappointed. We passed on dessert because it didn't look appetizing. Im glad we did. Im sure we would've been disappointed by it too. Won't be returning here.

Good bbq is hard to find and this place is awesome. The prices are reasonable and the place is usually packed. The brisket and Mac and Cheese are really good. If your looking for good bbq, this place does not disappoint.

Not usually a big fan of bbq but this place is delicious! The pulled pork sandwich is great. I love their sauce, the homemade applesauce and Mac and cheese as well as the house made root beer! Yummy :) love the atmosphere and style. My son loves picking out old fashioned candy from the little station and my favorite is the chocolate chip cookies! They are to die for! The other desserts look pretty great too, I want to try them but I always end up going for the chocolate chip cookie they're amazing :) never had a problem with this place! Good bbq the whole family loves it

Hey Jooooooe, where you going with that BBQ sauce in your hands?

Not my house- that's for sure. 

I ordered about $150.00 worth of takeout and when I got home I had zero BBQ sauce. Well, actually I had two tiny single serve cups that I asked for as "extra sauce" , to go along with the sauce that was in there (or not, in this case).  It's a shame because the employee working take out was super friendly and made a point of showing all the items I ordered. Maybe it's my fault for not specifically asking for sauce? When I called to order, I was told you get four ounces per pound of meat, and I ordered three pounds of brisket (in addition to a bunch of other stuff)- so it should have come with a fair amount of sauce. I know this is a first world problem, but when you're feeding a bunch of people BBQ, and you're lacking a pivotal component- it sucks.  It's worth noting I drove 35 minutes in rush hour to get to Joes, then 40 minutes back home. Womp x3. 

The food was very good even despite the error. I can only imagine how amazing it would have been with all the components.

I'm from California so this was my first time here. I ordered the ribs an brisket along with Mac and cheese. I also had the privilege of trying their homemade root beer. Everything was so tasty! I wish I could've tried everything but now this just gives me an excuse to go here again when visiting this cute little town. The meat was so tender and the bbq sauce was delicious. The cute little BBQ place even has a patio where the kids can play. Perfect for my one year old son who can't sit still at any restaurant.

I found Joe's Real BBQ listed on the AOLcityguide as the #3 spot in the Phoenix area for BBQ.  I have a hard time believing this place is really the third best. Our group tried a sampling of many different items. For us, none lived up to what others had said. The pulled pork was tender but didn't have much flavor. The chicken breast was good, although dry. My kids both liked the ham and the mac & cheese was pretty good. Our group also tried the ribs, which were tender but not falling off the bone, which a St. Louis style rib shouldn't do. We also tried the jumbo baker (without the meat) which was tasty. A disappointment to us was that, although we could smell the smoke when we exited our car, none of the food had any smoke flavor. But, this is just the opinion of some travelers from Chicago. Others obviously like Joe's a lot because there was always a steady stream of people lining up to place their orders.

10//16/2017
yelp Review
Joe's real BBQ
Gilbert AZ
301 N Gilbert Road
Gilbert, AZ 85234

I have been eating at Joe's Real BBQ for about 18 years. This is one of my favorite places to eat I am a native to the southwest so I have never tried real Texas, southern BBQ. I can say that I have tried other BBQ restaurants around here in the phoenix area and they are nowhere near the quality of Joe's. 
There is usually about 15-30 minutes wait just to order/ get your food that is how long the line gets. 

It is pretty cool because the first thing is get your drink then you view a menu that is 6'x4' that is mounted on the wall. Then you pick up a tray, plate, and your utensils this reminds me of a school cafeteria three to four people. The first ask takes your menu and yields out what type of meat. The second ask what side(s) you want, as they are placing your side(s) on your plate are add your choice of meat. Their meat is never dry, it is moist always delicious. The third one asks if you would like any dessert. Then the last one takes your money. When your done paying you can add your own warm BBQ sauce you get to choose between a mild and spicy. They have bar where you can add your condiments. Which their food is served on a 12" plate it presentation is very nice and the food is delicious.my favorite thing to eat is the stuffed baker which is one pound baked potato topped with butter sour cream, cheese chives and ¼ of a pound of your favorite of meat I get the pulled pork and top it off with BBQ sauce and its 8.99. Their side are good as well that's if end ordering a plate.

The price for dinner is affordable for a family of four can run you around 30 - 40 dollars. The most expensive thing is a full rack of ribs that are 18.99. kids' meals are 4.99 / 5.99 you have to different choices a sandwich or rib meal. Oh yeah cannot forget about the homemade root beer that is 2.49 for all fountain drinks. they sell bottle soda imported from Mexico they are in the glass bottles and there are 2.99  

The atmosphere is very clean and friendly it is like you're at a family reunion dinner they have outside sitting and inside with a farmer's theme from the 1940's or early 50's the staff always welcoming and tables are cleaned off.
Service if they are missing something from the condiments bar and you let one of the staff members know the straight to the kitchen ask the cooks for a refill, then they get a side plate and bring right to you. They never seem unset or mad. When you are sitting and have a conversation and one of the staff see that your cup in nearly empty they will ask you if you would like a refill.

A bunch of friends and I went to Joe's after a trip down to Queen Creek Olive Mill & The Pork Shop.  I found out later that it was the same owner as Joe's Farm Grill, makes sense, I actually had a pretty similar feeling after eating at both places.  I can see why people like both places, they have a bit of a retro feel/history to them that is sorely lacking in AZ, especially if you are from the Midwest or back East.  Both spots also offer expansive shaded patio seating.
While the Farm Grill was a little better to me food wise-hard to screw up burgers, chicken sandwiches, fries and onion rings (though I've been to plenty of spots that have screwed these dishes up plenty :) I had a little higher hopes for the BBQ joint.  I was underwhelmed.
1/2 lb. two meat two side combo that I shared with my buddy:
Ribs-Two spareribs.  Yes, TWO WHOLE SPARE ribs. Forgettable, hardly any smoke.
Chicken-A maybe 3-4 oz. boneless skinless breast that was smoked then BBQ sauce drizzled over the top??  Where's the yardbird Joe??  Good smoky flavor but not what I'm used to I guess.
Sides-An ice cream scoop of mac-n-cheese and a second scoop of cheesy potatoes.  The mac-n-cheese was good, the potatoes not so much very blah.
Cookie :)  The chocolate chip was good and I'm not even much of a fan of sweets.
Fifteen bucks for one meal  with a small pop that I did share with my buddy, had I known the portions would be the size they were I would have suggested we get our own lunches...

Another  local favorite! Not a chain, great  food, great experience. Yes it can be busy  where there  is a line around the corner but it moves quickly, and doesn't  disappint.  I am not  a red meat eater, so I eat their  turkey sausage which  is amazing!
Nothing beats their 1/2 lb. meat and 2 sides (my choice was chicken & turkey plus cole slaw and garden salad). Home-made rootbeer... mmm hmmm!!

Wow! I'm impressed! What a treat!  On a Monday night, we were happy to see the place bustling and our senses satisfied.  First, the food looks amazing!  As you stand in line contemplating what to order, people walk past you with heaping plates of delicious looking food on their plate.  Then the wonderful smells hit you!  Pork, bbq chicken, beef brisket, ribs, corn bread, cheesy potatoes, Mac and cheese, desserts. Yum.

The portions are huge.  Two people can split a 3/4 lb meat platter with 2 sides.  Sandwiches such as pulled pork were fantastic!  

All kinds of cool sodas and fountain drinks are offered.  And prices?  So reasonable!

I've been to a few places around town. This was good but not my favorite. The pulled pork was a little blan and the brisket was a little dry. Overall though not bad, would defiantly go again if I find myself on that end of town. The only real obstacle is if you want more water you gotta fight to get between people in line. I think the drinks could be moved so it's not behind a busy line.

Been coming here for 15 years and love it!  Everything is good here but I especially like the turkey.  The sides are all very good.  For something different, go for the 1lb baked potato with meat on top!!!!  They have great homemade lemon cake too!

I usually love coming to Joe's BBQ, but yesterday was just an alright experience. I got my food to-go and the girl working was nice, but it seemed like she was rushing too much. I know she wants to get the food out fast, but I think she should step down a notch and get things right before trying to get things out faster. When my food became ready, I mentioned she forgot my drink and she only filled the cup up 2/3 of the way. I was going to ask for it to be filled all the way but there was a line behind me, so I didn't want to keep asking for things. The drink was about $2.49. When I got home, I realized that there was no BBQ sauce on the sandwich. I don't know if it was my fault for not asking for BBQ sauce, but I thought the sandwich usually comes with it because the sandwich was too dry without it. It still tasted good though. I would still recommend coming here, but I would recommend going inside instead of getting to-go.
Average food and pricey too.  Three ribs a bit dry and tough plus an out of the bag garden salad with a 12 oz. soda alone,  ran me 14 bucks!

This place is busy!
I went on a Wednesday evening with a large group of friends.  We made it through the line quickly and sat outside at reserved tables.

Pros:
The atmosphere is fun and friendly.  The owners' father greeted us at the front of the line and helped with questions.  That was a very nice touch.  I ordered the Meat Plate - which gave me a choice of two meats up to 1/2#, bread and a side.  I chose the pulled pork, and the brisket in sauce with coleslaw as my side.  Everything was delicious!  I even overcame my disappointment that I would have to pay extra for corn bread when I realized the bread that came with the meal had cheese and peppers baked in.  

Cons:
Paying for corn bread.  I just feel like this is a given at a BBQ place, and should not be something to pay extra.
No Beer.  Again - at a BBQ, I would like some type of alcohol, and even watered down can beer would have been welcome.
A bit cafeteria-esque... taking my lunch tray outside to eat on a picnic bench was fun, but also felt really like middle school all over again.  I think eating inside would not have been better as it was really loud and busy.

Parking - downtown Gilbert has grown so much it can be hard to find a good spot.  I lucked out and parked right behind the restaurant to the east.  There is a fee lot back there, as well as free parking on the side streets.

I really enjoyed my food, as did everyone else in my party!  I think this may become a take out place for me.  That way I can get the delicious BBQ and then eat it at home with my beer at a real table. Maybe even on my patio ;-) .

It was a real local treasure. I was thrilled to have been taken here on my first week in the Valley. 

Quality has dipped and competition has improved (Little Miss is the bomb).

Delish! This is a must-go restaurant! 
The pit ham and smoked turkey are to die for delicious, as is the brisket! 
Love the sides as well (try the cheesey potatoes) and the loaded baked potato is sinfully delish! 
There is always a line (evidence of a good restaurant) but it's worth the wait! 
I highly recommend Joe's Real BBQ!

A very kid friendly place to have a BBQ meal. You order your food as if you were in a cafeteria setting. You grab a tray, grab your drinks, and go up to the counter to order your meal. Then you push your tray along and grab your sides. Once you got everything and paid for your meal you find a seat inside or head outside (if it's not too hot) to sit at a park bench. You eat for free on your birthday so be sure to bring something to verify your birthday. We even had the opportunity to be greeted by Joe himself as he made his way from table to table asking how things were and to thank you for coming to visit. I thought that was very classy. We will be back once we are in the mood for more BBQ. 


Visited April 2012

Delicious food, good customer service. 
I recommend chopped brisket sliders, mac and cheese, must try the homemade root beer.
One of my favorite restaurants in the Gilbert area.

This Texas transplant loves BBQ, despite my part time vegan tendencies. When I go out of town, I have to try a barbecue joint, in the hopes that I find better than Vegas. Joe's was a gem! The location has indoor and outdoor seating, and it speaks to their quality that they've been in business now 19 years.

Layout is a little different, with a walkup cafeteria style ordering system- don't be surprised if the line stretches down the dining room, out the door, and around the building, the line moves pretty quick. Definitely have someone in your group stake out a table, or expect to sit community-style.

Went for the sampler plate to get a little bit of everything: plate comes with two massive ribs, pork and brisket (sliced please!), and chicken (they didn't ask for preference but I received a breast). The portion is said to be about 3/4lb, and it seemed even bigger. Great value for $13! Added on sides of mac and a salad (comes with a thousand island style dressing). While I couldn't rave about everything on my plate, the brisket is nicely fatty without being too marbled and the chicken is well-seasoned. Note that the side of "cheesy potatoes" is an au gratin version no one at our table of 6 liked. Don't leave without getting their sweet potato pie- it's great! Huge portion, low price, easily shareable, great southern sweetness to end your meal.

Staff, in addition to running the line smoothly and clearing tables quickly, are friendly and upbeat to match the southern charm of the place. Seems like Joe's has what it takes to stick around another 19 years!

TIP: In a rush? They have a takeout window, call ahead. They also do catering.

The food was decent, but this wasn't the best bbq experience this time after not having gone to Joe's for over a year. The brisket was the problem today. It just was way too fatty and not tender enough. I usually order the chopped version which is always safer, but skip the sliced style because it was really not good. I had the baked tater concoction with turkey. The turkey needed some more smoke flavor, but overall still a decent carb filled lunch. Also liked the sliced bread and the chicken is really the best meat this place serves. Freshly made root beer was also not the best version I have encountered - more of a sasparilla taste.

Great barbecue -- especially the chicken and pulled pork. The cheesy potatoes and homemade applesauce are good side dish options. The jumbo bakers with barbecued pulled pork and all the fixings of a baked potato are really good. It's a good family place with indoor and outdoor seating options.

Here's the thing about Joe's...for how good the bbq meats are (and they're really good!), the side dishes are better. The mac and cheese is killer; so are the stuffed potatoes and baked beans. The salad is incredible. This is a fun restaurant with really yummy food. Very informal and relaxed atmosphere.

My uncle owns a pretty famous bbq restaurant in Memphis, TN. So I am always a bbq sceptic and tough critic. I have only tried the pulled pork sandwich and the bbq chicken breast sandwich. Both really good. All the way down to the bun it comes on....tasty and not too thick. The potato salad is good, except I did miss the chopped egg. A few customers walked by me w/ amazing looking deserts that made my mouth water. The true test of great bbq is the ribs. Next time I shall try them and update....".y'all come back now, ya hear?"

All I have to say is pulled pork sandwhich, it is so yummy and huge for the price. You can eat here for under $8 and be stuffed. The only bad thing about this place is they dont serve ranch, but they do serve bbq-ranch which is petty good. The mac n cheese is amazing also its crunchy on the top its great. 

I like that you can get your own soda and water its set up like a caferteria, which to me is really cool concept. The cookies are also amazing for $1.25 I would tell anyone to try this place its really good.

Love the stuffed baker here. The potato is about the size of a football with all the butter, sour cream and chives you can handle. I have really enjoyed the sliced brisket lately. Used to be more of a pulled pork guy but the brisket is GREAT!!!!

Contrary to other reviews, the wait just seems long because of the cafeteria style ordering. It goes by pretty quickly and we took the time to look through the extensive menu. The sides all looked very appetizing and it was tough choosing which ones to try. Luckily, the portions were just right so you could get more than 1 and not be spultuffed. I got the beans and potato salad which were both excellent. My gf tried the mac and cheese and cheesy potatoes. Macn cheese was excellent, but the potatoes were just ok. For main course, I figured I'd try a taste sampler of all their meats in the form of sliders: pulled pork, turkey, and beef brisket. The turkey was surprisingly moist and not dry.  Pulled pork and beef were my favorites. The bbq house sauce and spicy sauce were both excellent, i couldn't get enough of them.  

I also loved their fresh, house made sodas and root beer, lemonades. I'll have to save room for their delicious looking desserts next time. The only thing better to go along with all the great meat would be some cold beer.

A little disappointed...  We have been waiting for the right moment to visit this place and today turned out to be that day.  First of all, the location is in the middle of what looks to be a ghost town.  The interior had a lot of character with items like the family owned John Deer tractor ;)  Anyway, we had the full slab with 2 sides, a bottle of ginger beer and a drink.  Honestly, I expected more from this place.  The meat was dry, bland and over done.  My bf and I both agreed that our fav in Arizona is still Famous Dave's where pay pretty much the same price, get to sit and relax while they serve you, and the food is better.  

*Location = kinda out there
*Price = for a cafeteria style bbq....I think it's a little much
*Food = it's not all that...at least to us
*Decor = very classic and full of character

*** I just received a really nice message from the owner, Joe.  I think it's wonderful that Joe cares about each customer's comments and reviews.  Even though my review was not a very positive one, Joe was polite and very kind.  Thank you Joe and I think I'm definitely gonna persuade my bf to try your restaurant again :)***

Joe's Real BBQ has never disappointed me. 
I would recommend any pork meat; whether it's pulled pork, brisket, or ribs. The meat is always very tender and flavorful. Some other must haves are also the Mac and cheese and cookies! The Mac and cheese is not too heavy and they top it off with what tastes like cheez itz; the cookie is fresh, warm, and gooey. 

Tip 1: Portions are generous. In my experience, both the sampler and sandwiches are enough to share (I've always gone home with a box) 

Tip 2: On your birthday, you get $10 off your meal!

Food was good not great.  I can say that I could tell it was fresh and home made. Their root beer was not a hit with the boyfriend. 

We had a bbq sampler plater. The smoke ring on the meat was impressive but couldn't really taste the smoky goodness I was looking for. Mind you I dont like things overly smoked I am not a fan of el passo or daves ribs just because of the over powering smoke flavor. 

I couldnt pass up a slice of the obviously home made sweet potatoe pie. But had a hard time deciding if it was a pumpkin or sweet potato when eating it. Dont get me wrong it was a good slice of pie just not fantastic.

This restaurant is self serve style. The line is usually long (15-20min) during lunch and dinner time. There is plenty of seating, inside and outside. I like the meat options including chicken and turkey breast. There is a good selection of sides. I especially like the beans. They have homemade root beer on tap which is very tasty. They are also very accommodating for Gluten Free patrons as myself. Having Celiac can often be challenging when eating out. They offer a $10 meal on your birthday.
Wanted to love it, but don't.  Don't understand the hype.  Didn't even finish my ribs.  The definition of "meh" for me.

Been going for 20 years and always loved it. Something has happened. Change in management? Ownership? 6 of us went for lunch and everyone was shocked how bad it was. Rude employees, old leftover Mac and cheese, dry dry pulled pork, so much sauce on brisket sandwich could not taste the meat. Very disappointed and will not return. Sad!!

Fun place. Walk in and go thru a cafeteria style line. I had the ribs which were awesome !!! Mac n cheese was great. Cheesy potatoes were just okay. The root beer float is a must as is the root beer cake !!! My wife had the sliders. The pulled pork and chicken were great, the beef- not so great. Fun place to go with kids. Like the atmosphere. Drink refills are cumbersome cause it's at the start of the food line so you kind of have to cut thru the line to fill er up.

I went to Joe's Real BBQ on my birthday (showed ID) and received $10 worth of food to take home. I ordered the sampler plate (paid difference since over $10) .. The food is really good, first time here. Customer service was good, clean place.
I'll come back again. 

(*this review was not on the same day of visit)

Waited about 45 to 50 minutes in line with obnoxious people in front of me the whole wait. Ordered the meat plate with 2 sides. I had beef brisket and ribs. Beef brisket was great, the ribs were nothing special. The mac n cheese was very good, but i did not like the cheesy potatoes. The food was not hot, just lukewarm. Kinda disapointing to not receive hot food after standing for an hour. I dont know if id return again due to the wait, and the way its set up, and not getting hot food. It felt kinda like being served left overs that were reheated.

Good part:   Appeared to be a locals favorite an have a local theme
Rest of story: you stand in line for cafeteria type service.  You by pass people with heir food already who are hunched over their food like prisoners.  Then you get your drinks and go to the counter.  I ordered pulled pork and pork ribs with baked beans and Mac and cheese.  The lady behind the counter responded "¿Qué?".  Silly me for only speaking the national language of English.  After two more tries she finally is able to understand my order.  So I get my order and I mention they were really light on the sauce.  She told me not to worry you can get more.  So we pay then get sit down.  But wait there is no one to clean up the mess of previous people or trash cans at the end doors to dump your trash.  So you get to pick up the trash of the previous guests and pile it on the ledges with the rest.  Not sure how that doesn't attract other little critters.  So my Girlfriend brings up the BBQ sauce as I finish clearing off a place to eat.  Again I was wrong to assume that BBQ sauce was supposed to be thick like ketchup and not pour like water.  Now we finally get to eat and the meat was dry and it was obvious the sides were boxed/canned and just warmed up.  Then while trying to supplement the moisture from the drink I ran out.   So I get to stand in line with the hungry crowd again and walk past all the prisoners guarding their food to refill at the only soft drink station.  Also stick with the Barq's root beer, the home made tastes like a "diet" version.   Needless to say in the end I was not impressed at all

Great BBQ, easy parking (huge lot right behind), good prices, extremely quick and friendly service, and overall a great experience. I had a brisket sandwich with a side of pulled pork and mac n cheese. Each was delicious.

I've been here many times since I moved down here 10+ years ago. I really like this place. I'd say the BBQ is above average, and thus the 4 stars. But the service is friendly and the atmosphere is homey. I like their ribs but it can be a tad dry at times. Maybe I like them meatier. I swear they used to give you 3 ribs, but now 2. The pulled pork is pretty good. I think I like my brisket fattier. Otherwise it's too dry. The hotlinks are pretty good. Love their cheesy potatoes and pit beans. I think they have the best bbq sauce anywhere. Yep, I think that's why I really like Joe's. They are fairly close and they have awesome bbq sauce. As far as the actual meat goes, I like them, but I like Stacy's smokehouse better. :) Only wish Joe's have beef ribs.....

Back to Joe's.... been several years as we are Westside dewelers and on Mother's Day we had Mom & Dad with us and suggested Joe's after the hot experience out at Schenpf''s farm.  Glad we went, Joe's really is quite tasty, is it the best? - Probably not but that is all relative!  For the SE Valley, it's our go to spot for BBQ.  We had the ribs, pulled pork, the Jumbo tater with Pork, coleslaw, mac & Chz, lemon cake, sweet patato pie.  All were really quite tasty.  The "HOT" sauce isn't THAT hot... but good lil kick.  One time we will be there when it's not as hot out and get to try that nice large outdoor seating!  - I gotta say the Lemon Cake kicks ass!

After years of dining out in Arizona while I lived here, Joe's BBQ is my one required stop every time I'm back to visit. I grew up in Gilbert so I've seen Downtown Gilbert grow a lot from almost nothing to the hot spot it is now but Joe's has always been at the center of the action (and for good reason). You can't get within half a mile of this place without smelling it first! My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

All the food here is incredible and that's what keeps me (and the line of people usually stretching out the door) coming back. I love the ribs when I'm feeling up to it and don't mind getting a little messy but my go-to is a BBQ sandwich with either the pulled pork or chopped brisket. The meats are all pecan-smoked and perfectly tender and the chopped brisket is even cooked in their signature BBQ sauce so the flavor is in every bite. They also have a station where you can get more BBQ sauce or Spicy BBQ sauce and pour it all over everything (I prefer to mix the two so it's got a kick but it's not too spicy). 

In addition to the all the delicious meat options, the sides are a standout as well. The mac and cheese is my all-time favorite, with plenty of gooey cheesiness (totally a word) and a flaky topping, and the cornbread with honey butter really hits the spot. The cheesy potatoes and BBQ pit beans are very popular as well! As far as drinks go, Joe's makes their own homemade root beer and lemonade which are both a refreshing complement to the smoky barbecue. And if you have room, go for the root beer cake or chocolate chip cookie: both desserts are a simply amazing way to end the meal.

Not only is their food unparalleled around here but the customer service is second to none and they even give free meals on your birthday, in addition to a few days every year where they serve free lunches to everyone. It's cafeteria-style so you wait in line, get your drink, then order your food and they give it to you before paying at the cash register. Even though the line can get long, trust me...the wait will be torturous but so so worth it!

I love this place.  I go again and again, even though it is a good 40 minute drive.  Everything they have is always delicious, and the staff is friendly!  Plus you eat FREE on your birthday, what is not to love!

Pulled pork is one of my faves with macaroni and cheese!

Good BBQ, great price! I got a full slab of ribs, 2-meat plate w/ brisket & hot link, 2 sides of coleslaw, potato salad, and apple cobbler all for around $50. Their coleslaw is the best, I think they put apple slices - so refreshing! And their desserts have a homey taste to them. Service is also great. I needed help carrying my trays and the lady behind the counter came out to assist.
Awesome BBQ! Fun themed place. Always fresh and delicious. Quick service with friendly staff. Our "go to" for BBQ!!
I love Joe's Real BBQ. The food is fantastic and I just love to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful Arizonian weather. Family friendly. A great place to hang out and eat.
Joe's BBQ is awesome!  The pulled pork, chopped brisket and Ribs rival the best in Texas.  The sides are just like my mom used to make--superb.

I'm admittedly impatient but will gladly wait for food if it's good. Unfortunately, Joe's didn't really live up to expectations. Line on a weekday moved very slowly.  It wasn't even busy with plenty of open seating everywhere. How hard is it to serve up some premade food cafeteria style? It was hot and stuffy in the main dining room. Care to temperature control?  

Thankfully, the brisket itself was pretty tender and flavorful. Everything else about the experience was just 'meh.' I was not a fan of the two bbq sauces offered. They had an off-putting bitterness. Cole slaw didn't have bite and cheesy potatoes were passable. The mac and cheese, I'll give, was quite tasty. Don't think I'll be back. Lot's of other bbq places in the Valley to try.

Without a doubt, the best bbq restaurant in Southeast Valley. Always beyond expectations, so delicious!  I like the walk-up window if the line inside gets too long.  

Make a point of eating here, you won't be sorry you did.
Great BBQ!! Comfy family atmosphere! We've eaten here quite a few times and love it! Don't let the big crowds scare you , they're excellent!

I was looking for a place to find true BBQ in Phoenix and I sure as hell found it with Joe's.  I got the sampler platter which is a combination of the most popular meat they serve... ribs, chicken, and pulled pork.  Everything was phenomenal and a great environment too.  I went to school at PSU where we are lucky enough to get Clems BBQ, this makes up for good ole clem and then some.  Definitely will go again, good look Joe.
Not the best bbq i have had, but a great atmosphere, good portions, and nice outdoor seating.

My sister has rant and raved about this place and wanted me to give it a try. One day we took a trip to Joes real BBQ and the lines were long no complaint here I will wait in the lines just to see if it was worth and yes it was definitely worth.

I split my sampler because its such a big amount of food that I would not be able to finish it myself. The sampler consists of ribs, pulled pork, briskets, and chicken with 2 sides we usually get cole slaw and mac n cheese.

It was definitely worth the experience and I have and would continue to eat at this place when ever I crave for their sampler. 

We also got our friends addicted to Joes we took them there for the first time and a couple of months later they went back on their own. 

Definitely a place to go to if you haven't gone there yet.
Been going here for years and love it. I wouldn't say my all time favorite but good BBQ

I love Joe's Real BBQ! As soon as you sink your teeth into any one of the tasty meats you can taste the pecan wood smoke flavor!!! I have yet to get something here that I didn't like. Do yourself a favor and get the three meat sampler and some cheesy potatoes and your belly will love you!! the service is awesome as well!! always a friendly smile when you go in!
This is the best BBQ in the east valley, maybe one of the last places that give you a birthday meal!

My expectations may have been too high entering this establishment.  The meat itself was decent, but the sauces and sides were huge letdowns.  The sides were severely underseasoned and the sauces just didn't seem to have the right combination of sweet and spicy flavors.

I've been coming here for 10 years and still love it. The bbq beans are really good. My favorite thing to get here is a jumbo baker (and they mean jumbo) with everything on it including a side of chopped beef and then I add their homemade bbq sauce to it. Sooooo good. Their homemade root beer and limeade are also yummy. I remember them having a customer appreciation day once a year (I think in May) where lunch and dinner and free! You would get a pulled pork sandwich, a side and a drink for nothing. The lines would be out the door, but the food is worth the wait. I also remember them offering a free dinner (can't remember the choices) on your birthday. It's a cute little place in downtown Gilbert. Check it out.

We were in the area for Dodgers spring training, it was about 10-15 min away from our hotel but worth the trip, best BBQ ive had and you cant beat the price. We went for lunch on saturday and while we were in line, the line reached outside the door... it is cafetia style so the line goes by pretty quick. Loved the mac and cheese, tri tip and the cornbread....i will DEFINITELY come back and recommend this place to anyone in the area:)
First class BBQ! Don't mess around with anything else besides a slab of ribs, mac and cheese and beans. Nough said.
Today was Customer Appreciation Day at Joe's so a big THANK YOU to Joe's.  Always enjoy the pulled pork and beans.

What can you say about Joe's BBQ other than it's the best BBQ in Arizona and better than 99% of places in the US.  Joe's is in a old brick building in downtown Gilbert and just accept that it'll be crowded no matter if it's lunch or dinner Ive seen the line go outside and down the sidewalk on ,amy occasions.   And it's well worth the wait trust me on this.  Pulled Pork, Brisket, Chicken, Sausage, Beef sliced and ground if you can Bbq it it's here.  Add amazing wood smoke flavoring a hot spicy sauce thats wonderful and you've got BBQ Nirvana.   Like baked potatoes well get ready they have baked potatoes that look like footballs with the logos sanded off.  There baked to perfection and come with BBQ or plain.   Plain here means Butter, Sour cream, Chives, Cheese all on the side to make your own but you can't go wrong.   all the side are great and fresh and they even make there own Root beer and Cream Soda.   And for desert the lemon cake is hard to beat.    I'm lucky to live so close last time I was there the guy behind me was from Glendale a good 40 mite drive he said he does probably twice a month and I'm not surprised.

Joe's is good BBQ with a great atmosphere.  The meat is generally pretty good and the sides are excellent.  I think I could eat the beans all day if that wouldn't result in being kicked out of my own house.  They really seem to care about their customers (customer appreciation day = free food) and from what I hear, they are crazy about the consistency of their food.

If you really want to get a taste for their food, do the BBQ sampler...otherwise the meat plate should be plenty of food for most people.

This is my favorite bbq spot in Arizona. The sauce is sweet and delicious. They have a spicy one too. The pulled pork is the best, especially on a jumbo baked potato. The sliced brisket can be fatty, if that's your thing. This place is huge and on the weekend, be prepared to wait in a long cafeteria-style line. Downtown Gilbert is an awesome location.

I love Joe's and their bbq sauce.  I prefer a sweeter type of bbq sauce versus a vinegary sauce so this is the perfect bbq place for me.  I find their regular sauce with the perfect amount of sweetness.  I went with the family right around dinner time and the line was almost out the door on a Thursday night.  We probably had to wait about 10-15 minutes before ordering.  We got a full slab of ribs and two sides, beans and mac and cheese.  Their beans are the best as it has the perfect amount of sweetness, beans, and good amount of bits of brisket.  The ribs were very good, but there were probably a couple of ribs that were a bit dry.  The best thing, the meal only cost less than $5 since I got a $10 credit for my birthday!  Great place for bbq if you prefer more of a sweeter sauce.

I was in the area for work and my colleague mentioned this place for lunch.

I'm all about BBQ. So needless to say, I was in.

This place is located in a really interesting place in Gilbert. It looks "small towny" with character. 

As I walked in, I don't know what I was expecting. But I was a little surprised to see that it is set up kind of like a cafeteria. Interesting. 

I got, what I believe was called, the two meat platter. I got the beef brisket and the pulled pork. 

Holy moley.

It was so good. I slathered it with the BBQ sauce and was super satisfied. 

But that wasn't enough, I had to try their hot BBQ sauce. 

I slathered my food in it. Nose dripping with sweat, lips burning, but man was it good. 

I came out of the restaurant smelling like BBQ. Which is fine with me. 

The prices were reasonable too!

Love this place but it only received a three due to seating issues. There were two large outside areas reserved   This meant that regular customers were left circling holding full trays  trying to find somewhere to eat.   The booths along the side are horrible horrible to eat in as people standing in line watch you eat and listen to conversation.   Not one of my better joes experiences

First off I love good BBQ,  but I am a little picky in the fact that I don't want my food drowned in sauce, I want to be able to taste the flavor of the meat. Joe's Real BBQ  does just that, they serve you all the meats you want with the sauce on the side, with the exception of the ribs. I was a big fan of Rudy's BBQ for that same reason as well however I must say Joe's is much better. The meat by itself has very good flavor and its cooked to perfection. We tried the beef brisket, pulled pork, hot-links, and the ribs. I loved the brisket, it was so moist and flavorful. The ribs, while the sauce was a little sweet for me the meat just fell off the bones. My husband really enjoyed the hot-links along with the pulled pork. They do have a lot of options for sides however they were a bit small in portions, our favorite side was the mac and cheese. The atmosphere is welcoming with the family style picnic type seating.

Great place. I got the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with sides of Mac and cheese and cornbread.

Pros:
Great BBQ sauce
Amazing warm sweet cornbread 
Super friendly staff
Mac & cheese was delicious

Cons:
Line is super awkward, hard to get drink refills if you want them (with water or anything else)
Super cold in the restaurant
The meat was good, but had a lot of fat in it

Great place to bring big groups because it's relatively inexpensive and buffet style. It's tasty BBQ, some of the best in the area. Brought some friends here tonight because they're new here, they really liked it too.

Good barbecue, but not great. I ordered the BBQ Sampler and shared with my wife.  With an extra side and a delicious chocolate chip cookie for dessert, it was plenty of food.  Unfortunately, the quality of the food wasn't as high as I was expecting based off of all the Yelp reviews. All of the meats were very tender... The brisket and pulled pork especially.  But they were devoid of significant taste and had to be drowned in BBQ sauce in order to taste anything.  Thankfully the sauce was excellent and readily available.  Of all the meats I sampled, the winner here was the ribs.  Definitely not the meatiest, but extremely tender. I could pull the bones right out and devour.  Delicious!

Outside of the food, everything was excellent.  I arrived at peak time on a Saturday night, and the line moved quickly.  It snaked through the restaurant and out the door, around the corner, but it moved quickly.  We waited no longer than 30 - 40 minutes.  All of the servers were extremely nice and helpful.  There was plenty of seating available, especially outside.  It was a lovey place to enjoy a meal.  It is unfortunate that the quality of the BBQ does not rise above "medium" to match the high quality of the rest of Joe's Real BBQ.

I've only been once, but I can't wait to go back. My husband and I tried the sampler plate and it was AMAZING. Plenty of food for 2 people. The brisket was so tender. Best I've ever had (I've tried it at 4 different BBQ places).  I was hoping the applesauce was chunky and homemade, but it looked and tasted more like it was from a can (pureed) and they added some pink food coloring. However, since I didn't go there for the applesauce, it still gets 5 stars.  The meat was the best BBQ I've had. Their BBQ sauce is SO good.  Not too spicy, but just enough of a kick that you can still taste your food.  

Great place for kids too.

Yes the line is long however is the best place for ribs anywhere in arizona barbeque pork absolutely worth it we usually use the take out window we call in the food ready in about 15 minutes its a half a slab pulled pork sandwich all excellent great size great place to bring people from out of town it is by far the best place I know in Arizona right now to get  great barbecue

Visited the good old AZ since my college days, mainly to visit a GF who was extremely ill. Her and hubby took BF and I here for a quick lunch bite. 

Ambiance: rugged, simple, and friendly place.

Food: the BBQ sampler was quite delish and flavorful. (To be honest, i was so busy catching up with my friend on the years of lost communication, don't recall what I ate).

Overall: if it's your first trip to AZ, then make sure to stop by Joe's Real BBQ.
Love this place it is one of my favorite places in gilbert. If you are looking for some good BBQ this is the place.
Got the sampler (chicken, ribs, brisket, pulled pork) and everything was delicious! Only problem was the silverware was dirty; and I grabbed several utensils before finally notifying someone.
The food is great, reasonable prices but the line gets long at lunch so be there's early!

My husband would give this 5+ if he were writing the review.  Maybe it is because I am less of a meat person, but 4 seems right to me. They almost always have a line out the door, but it moves fast.  The meats are very good.  I like the brisket and husband likes the ribs. The sides are really good. I love the mac n cheese and baked beans. I had the root beer float for the first time and it was SOOOO good.  Best root beer float I've ever had.
This place is worth standing in line for. I recommend the mac 'n cheese.

Located in Old Town Gilbert. I've been going to Joe's Real BBQ for the past 10 years.  This has to be the best BBQ that I've tasted in the Phoenix area; East and West Valley. I usually get the Joe's Sampler plate which includes chicken, pulled pork, ribs and beef brisket and a couple of slices of their awesome bread. The meat comes just right with the right amount of sauce and flavor. You can add more sauce if you like. At $13.00 the meal is an excellent value. Two can eat off that one plate. If its your birthday you get $11.00 to apply to any meal. No other bbq place does that as far as I know. I went to one place not too far away and they wanted $27.00 for approximately the same meal.

Great atmosphere, friendly attentive service. I recommend taking the whole family to Joes.

If you want to see creepy ass people this is your place. You go line up cafeteria style and people with like straw hats try to stand on top of you and sing Gospel music in your ear. But only in a creepy taunting volume. ( I swear on my mom this is truely what happened) I have no clue where these people live but they come out of the wood work for this shit. 

I give the customers 1 star. 

The sauce is 4 stars for sure

The chopped bbq brisket was moist but wayyyy too salty, the get the buns from strictly from scratch bakery which is great but the buns were just eh. 
Jamie got the chicken sadwich which is chopped white meat she said it had a reat flavor but was dry and in big pieces like sliced. 
She exchaned for the pork which had a very butaney flavor my briset also had. Some reason the chicken didnt have that after taste. 

After being stared at for the 9 mins it took to eat we eagerly bailed. 

This was a very creepy experience for ok bbq.

Joe's has been a favorite of mine for many years. The food is delicious - real comfort food here. The ribs are a bit fatty, but most ribs are. Mac n Cheese, cheesy potatoes, beans, brisket, everything is really tasty.

This was tough to write. We were big fans of Joe's, but recently returning to the valley and looking forward to it, would have to bow out next time. 

We got pulled pork meat plate and pork with salad. How do I put this...the pork tasted like moth balls. I know, ew. Couldn't believe it. We tried smothering it with bbq sauce and just couldn't take it. It used to be SO good - what happened?! 

I understand the older crowd, we got there early around 4:30pm, but it used to be a friendly atmosphere. Not sure what happened this time, but didn't feel the love in the food or the people. Wouldn't go back.

Now Joe's bistro out there in Agritopia? - MUCH better! Plus, their onion rings rock! ;-)

I have been a customer of Joes for many years, and almost always the good is great. Yesterday it was not. My husband got the sausage and chicken. Both were overcooked and dry. My baked potato was overcooked as well. The mac n cheese was fantastic, and that is why I put 2 stars. The meat is usually juicy, and it was disappointing that our experience was not so.

There is perhaps no city in the Phoenix Metro that more exemplifies the postcard version of American suburbia than Gilbert.  There's also few towns in America that define suburban sprawl quite like Gilbert.  When I was born in 1981, Gilbert was a rural farm town with a population of 6,000 residents.  Today, Gilbert is a Phoenix suburb with more than 240,000 residents.  As with every Phoenix suburb, there's the inevitable clash between demand for the big brand name stores & restaurants you find everywhere & the local businesses trying to carve out a niche.  Without much debate, the one man most responsible for building Gilbert's emerging culinary identity is a Stanford graduate with longstanding ties to Gilbert's farming community.  Joe Johnston is many things.  A chef, a farmer, an entrepreneur, & a visionary.  Johnston owns three wildly popular Gilbert centric restaurants including Joe's Farm Grill & Liberty Market (both of which I've been to & give a thumbs up).  Joe's Real BBQ somehow managed to slip through my fingers all these years, but not today.

You'll find Joe's BBQ on the northeast corner of Gilbert Road & Page Avenue right in the heart of Downtown Gilbert's ever expanding culinary scene.  I happened to come on a Saturday at lunch & Downtown Gilbert (also known as the Heritage District) was jam packed with cars & pedestrians strolling the Downtown streets.  A quick piece of advice for those coming down here.  Park in one of the public parking lots on the perimeter of Downtown & take a short walk (I parked on Vaughn & Ash).  As soon as you walk inside Joe's BBQ you immediately get a sense of the family friendly farm personality that you find at each of Johnston's restaurants.  There's a John Deere tractor in the main dining hall with a mix of tables & booths with seating for at least 200 inside.  Out back, there's a patio with lots of picnic style seating & an open green space for the kids, & is ideal for catering big events.

Let's get something out of the way first.  Joe's Real BBQ is nothing like Little Miss BBQ & doesn't aspire to be.  Whereas Little Miss is market style, Joe's is cafeteria style.  Whereas Little Miss sticks to mastery of the basics, Joe's is putting just as much emphasis on the non-barbecue dishes as the barbecue itself.  So if you're a Little Miss fanatic like I am, set your expectations accordingly.  So here's how it works.  Grab a tray on the right side up front, load up your silverware & a drink, then get into the buffet line & tell the friendly counter staff what you're having.  Being the ever ambitious Yelper I am, I asked for a little bit of...well...as much as I could fit on my tray.  First off, the BBQ Sampler.  A plate with 3/4 pound of barbecued meat including pork ribs, brisket, pulled pork, & chicken.  Also comes with slices of Texas toast.  I went with two sides (out of about a dozen choices) and let the gal behind the counter choose the ones she thinks are best.  So a side of mac & cheese & a side of pit beans it was.  Lastly, I chose a dessert.  I went with one I've never heard of or seen anywhere else.  Their homemade root beer cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Total cost including a bottled water & tax came out to $23.  No long waits in line here (unlike Little Miss) as you're served in no time flat & sit wherever you please.

Let's start with the meats.  Each was lightly doused with sauce (though you can put more on if you want).  The ribs, brisket, & pulled pork were all respectable & well smoked & the sauce had a slightly sweet & tangy bite which I found quite pleasant.  Little Miss doesn't serve barbecue chicken so this was a new one for me.  I actually really liked the rub they used on the chicken breast & the meat was juicy & not dried out as chickens can often get when smoked.  Let's talk about the sides.  These were probably my favorite part of the meal.  Each homemade from scratch & it shows.  The pit beans had a hint of the barbecue sauce & had a hearty sweet texture to them without being too heavy.  The mac & cheese was indeed cheesy, almost ludicrously so in fact.  The breadcrumbs on the mac didn't do much for me, but the creamy thickness & flavor of the cheese more than made up for it.  Lastly, the root beer cake.  And it really does taste like root beer in cake form.  I can understand why they serve the ice cream on the side as it would've made a mess to just throw a scoop on top.  Delicious creation.

I would certainly put Joe's in the same distinguished company of local barbecue staples like Bobby Q, Pork on a Fork, & The Thumb.  The meats aren't of USDA prime quality like Little Miss (but then no one in AZ is), but Joe's knows what they're doing with the product they have.  And I give them a big thumbs up for the side & dessert dishes they serve here, with a wide variety of choices sure to please anyone.  Family friendly barbecue in the heart of the valley's most family friendly suburb.  Joe Johnston knows his audience very well.

My favorite restaurant in Gilbert.  This is my kind of BBQ.

I'm a huge fan of pulled pork, and their pulled pork is perfect.  I like the pulled pork so much that I haven't been able to try any of their other meat selections, which look great as well.  

On the sides frontier, their beans are excellent, as are the garlic potatoes and macaroni (real macaroni and cheese, not the box garbage).  

The root beer is also a can't miss.  I'm no root beer connoisseur, but let's just say that I quit drinking soft drinks, yet always have the root beer at Joe's.  If you want something different, the root beer cake is also delicious.

The best part?  The reasonable price.  A jumbo sandwich (1/3 pound), two sides, and a drink will cost you only $11-$12.  Cut that to the regular sandwich and one side (a more reasonable lunch option), and you're under $10.

I really like the format.   BBQ cafeteria style.  You pick what you want to eat-you take care of your own condiments-you stock up on napkins-and you choose from ample seating inside or out.  Joe's has plenty of room to stretch out, relax, play games, and generally have a good time.  The nice staff took good care of us when we came in so we were all smiles & had high hopes for a great experience.

Unfortunately, no one in my party was a big fan of the food.  I had the sliced beef brisket and the bone-in barbecue chicken.  My husband had ribs.  We also got a kids meal with pit ham and mac & cheese for my daughter. 

The brisket was flavorful & tender, but not in a standalone way.  It would probably be pretty good chopped on a sandwich but trying to eat the slices...well the meat was dry & yet somehow the texture was mushy.  

The chicken was cooked fine but the dry rub left me with kind-of a bad taste in my mouth, my husband said the same thing about the rib sauce. 

My daughter ate the ham but I found it watery rather than juicy.  

My husband like the cowboy beans but we both hated the soggy, flavorless cheesy potatoes.  The mac & cheese was fairly good homemade mac & cheese.

This could be a nice restaurant but the quality of food has to improve a lot to compete with other barbecue options.  Either that or the prices have to come way down.  We are unlikely to go back.

Drove nearly 45 min to get here and we were greatly disappointed that we did. I am a big BBQ fan and this was underwhelming. The food was ok, portions were small, it was pricey, and the service was bad. We got in line and carefully planned what we were going to get for us and our kiddos. It was finally our turn to order and they were out of almost everything we asked for. We watched them haul off several trays of food for catering - guess it impeded their ability to maintain their supply in the restaurant. We ended up with several items we didn't really want. The young girl manning the counter was inattentive, easily distracted by her fellow co-workers and unapologetic for being out of stuff. We finally got our food and headed for a table - but they were all dirty. We ended up finding the least dirty table and cleaning it off ourselves. 

I am not a fan and needless to say we will not be stopping in again.

Absolutely the BEST barbecue. Even better than Salt Lick in Texas. Don't think I can add any more than the other reviewers have, but you can rest assured that your BBQ craving will be satisfied and you will leave stuffed to the gills. Oh, and be sure to try the mac & cheese - it's awesome!

Joe's has a nice atmosphere and wonderful staff. I'm not sure if it's just been bad luck or off nights the past two times we've been, but the food has left a lot to be desired. Ribs had a lot of nasty gristle/ cartilage and fairly dry. Everything else was okay but nothing I couldn't get at a chain. 

I would much rather support a local business and will be returning at some point to have another go and see if it was just a couple of off nights.

If you're seeking out authentic BBQ, look no further. I sought Joe's out after reading about it in Mike Mills' book, Peace, Love and BBQ, and I was not disappointed. The ribs were delicious, and the sliced brisket was among the most tender I've ever had. Joe's uses pecan wood, which is unusual -- I'm more accustomed to hickory (not that I could detect a big difference). If I had to quibble, I'd say that I prefer my meat naked -- i.e., without sauce. The ribs had just a dash, which wasn't a big deal, but some of the sandwiches had considerably more. And if you're looking at dessert, beware of the pecan brownies -- they're heavy on the molasses!

Joe's Real BBQ is finger-lickin' good! 

My family and I visited Arizona last month, because my cousin lived here. My cousin took us here and I couldn't be more grateful she did. We were a party of 18 and occupied 3 tables. This place is pretty big, but very well kept. The setup here is that you stand in line, get your food (cafeteria style), sit and chow down!  It reminds me of family BBQs in the summer time. 

I ordered the Pulled Pork sandwich with two sides of cheesy potatoes and bbq beans. Ugh! So good! We also got the meat sampler and the ribs were unbelievably flavorful. I tried some of my sister's Mac N' Cheese and that too was delicious, especially with the crumbs on top. My younger cousin told me she's still dreaming about their smothered baked potatoes.

If I could give this place more than 5 stars, I would! Wish I could go back soon.

Simply awesome. Nice people. Great food. 


Updated : 2/6/2016 Scratch  the friendly service. Young lady running the take out window today is rude rude rude. Minus 2 stars. It is 11:30 Sunday
First time going here and I wanted to order everything on the menu! Small but awesome restaurant. Loved the pulled pork sandwich and Mac and cheese!!!

This was our only go to for BBQ until Bobby Q came to Stapley/Baseline. NO comparison!! Our last visit to Joe's, the BBQ was average at best, the cole slaw was grouse I couldn't even eat it. The servings seemed so much smaller than Bobby Q's and for a few more dollars I realized we could have a MUCH better meal at Bobby Q's. I have been starving for a good BBQ place since moving here from the south 25 years ago Joe's is NOT IT! I will say Joe's is a good place for families of screaming kids running everywhere so if you have those this is your place.

Delicious meat that was perfectly prepared and cooked! Loved the atmosphere, and service & would have given it 5 stars if not for a couple of things. 1. It was unclear what the protocol for getting trays, menus, utensils etc. I had to go back into line 2 times for trays and menus. 2. The sides were at best, average. Potato salad was very bland, and the cole slaw was equally flavorless. All in all the superb meat and atmosphere made up for what the sides lacked though, and I give it a pretty strong thumbs up.

Best BBQ in Arizona in my opinion.  There are better BBQ places in the country such as Spring Creek BBQ in Texas and Jim 'N Nicks in Alabama, but I highly recommend it whether you live in the Valley or are visiting from anywhere in the country including the places with great BBQ.  It's also in a quaint historic downtown Gilbert building and is a staple for Valley residents.

Also, you get a free meal on your birthday.  I went with my dad in January for his birthday.  Unfortunately, I missed going on mine in February.

Joes Bbq has been my go to Bbq joint for the last ten years. Everything I've tried has always lived up to my expectations, however i always go back to my chicken sandwich/Mac and cheese/cookie/lemonade. As my husband jokes, it would be my last meal on earth choice, which I can't deny! Make sure to take advantage of the pick up window, the lines can get a little crazy on Fridays and Saturdays but they move fast, don't be deterred. And the outside seating is lovely :)

If you love BBQ, this place is for you.  

Nostalgic feel with a farm tactor sitting in the dining room.  Good selection of sides and the rootbeer is home made.  

Like Joe's Farm Grill, this place can draw a crowd and you'll be in for a long wait for service but timing is everything.

Can be a bit pricey is you load up but the quality of the food is top notch!

I'll definately be back.

To be totally honest, I wasn't really impressed with Joe's. That's a sad thing to say because it's pretty much a Gilbert staple. The pecan smoke flavor was okay, but I thought the sauce was very very runny and not to my taste. 

The other major issue that I had was the way that the soda fountain was set up. During busy times you weren't able to get refills without pushing past what seems like 100 people. 

I've given it a few different tries, but I think I'll stick with what I know to be my taste in BBQ here in the valley.

Really Excellent BBQ Experience!

OK, I must admit that Texas spoiled me when it comes to two types of food. BBQ & Tex-Mex.

For the last 10 years in Phoenix I have been trying different BBQ places to find something that I think will measure up to those experiences and I finally found Joe's BBQ in Gilbert.

My favorite BBQ item is Brisket. It has to be cooked right and not many now how to keep in the flavor and still get it to come apart. these folks do.

I would recommend you do two things. Go with a partner and share. You can split a sampler plate and a 11 pound baked potato between the two of you and still have food to take home.

Otherwise, order up the brisket and try a baker. the corn was great as well and I tried the coleslaw but it's a little too dry to be Texas style so you take your chances there.

the other menu item I really liked was the ribs. this surprised me as I usually find most BBO's tend to over cook them making them too dry and tough. Not the case here. these were tender, moist and flavorful and the Pecan wood used to slow smoke them gave a nice flavor.

The atmosphere was typical BBO family style seating and self serve condiments.

The best place I have had BBQ in Texas was Rudy's BBQ. They served great Brisket but did something else that these folks miss. They offered a hand full of sliced bread with it (not toasted), had fresh Sliced onion and pickles as condiments and served the BBQ sauce in squeeze bottles at the table.

Unlike Rudy's, they have none of the above here at Joe's and I hate having to get up and down to get BBQ sauce and I also hate filling up little cups of the stuff and duping it on my food.

That being said, I give it 4 of 5 stars for doing a great job up to this point and I would totally go back better prepared to devour some nice brisket.

Enjoy!

I used to live in Mesa a while back and this was one of my favorite places to eat right over in Gilbert.  Locally owned and oh so delicious.  I think their pulled pork and beef brisket are the best in town.  I still give the Blue Ribbon trophy for pork ribs to Famous Daves.

The sides here are also very good...everything is homemade and I'd recommend you try a Stuffed Baked Potato....they give you what seems like a 10 pound potato with all the fixings...and just when you think the tray will break from the sheer weight of it...they pack it full of whatever meat you want.  I would not recommend eating this thing on a lunch unless you have a very understanding boss for when you fall asleep at 2pm.

I wish I dident live so far away now. I have no decent BBQ near me...:(

This is a great BBQ joint.  The portions and prices are great so come h-u-n-g-r-y!  
There's lots of seating.  I wasn't too impressed with the sides and we tried 4 different kinds.  The ribs were the best and then the pulled pork sandwich.

Good for a fast service. Macaroni is great and the chocolate chip cookies have always been the best but we went yesterday and they didn't taste the same. The buns they serve the meat on aren't the best either they are rather dry. Tried the cheesy potatoes and they don't taste like cheesy at all. Just potato's with a creamy salt-less substance all over them. 3 others thought the same thing. The lemon cake is amazing though

This place is to DIE for with BBQ. I have eaten at a ton of BBQ joints all across the USA including some of the best in the west in Texas and this place is at the too with BBQ. You will not be disappointed and the price is great as well.

This place is the bomb and if you don't like it, you don't know what good BBQ is. The ribs are fantastic, the pork is all smokey and juicy, the hot link rocks and the homemade sides are just like mom used to make, only better. My only beef with Joe's is they need to add another drink machine. Hate having to get back in line to get my drink on. Try the hot sauce, it's killer.

Excellent reliable BBQ and great serving sizes. My kids rated it 8/10. We ordered take out and were pleased with the fact that it was ready on time, had plenty of BBQ sauce, and they made sure everything we ordered was actually in the bag before we left (it's a 45 min round trip excursion to get take-out from Joe's so it's be a major bummer if our order wasn't right). BBQ beans are really good and made from a variety of beans and with some meat thrown in. I recommend the family pack from the take-out menu - great mix of meats with 2 pint-sized sides.

I can't believe I have been visiting my father who lives about 3 minutes away from Joe's for the past 4 years and I have never been here! It finally happened this past LDW. We walked in and smelled the BBQ in the air and instantly turned my mouth into water. There was a long line, almost reaching the door; however, the line moved really quickly! I was at the counter ordering within five minutes of arriving. I tried the BBQ sampler and was DEEEELICIOUS! The BBQ baked beans were awesome, as was their corn bread. The price was great! Total for two BBQ samplers, corn bread, four drinks, and a baked potato was shy of $40! I would definitely be visiting Joe's next time I am in town.

It doesn't get much better than this.  Good location, plenty of parking with a little walk, good food and good prices.  We go hear a lot on family events as well free birthdays.  This place never disappoints and can handle big groups.

The inside line can be a little discouraging when you first walk up but the food is well well worth it always a friendly stuff always clean good portions been coming here for years of my children absolutely love it

Okay, so my first job at age 15 was washing dishes at Fiorello's BBQ in a Kansas City and have lived in Memphis and Chicago too.  I'm guessing that changed my genetics and the red in my veins is actually sauce.  So imagine my supreme joy upon finding Joe's Real BBQ.  You will love this quirky little place.  The sides are excellent, especially the beans, which are not to be missed.  The main items have all been excellent, but a favorite lunch is just their huge baked potato with meat on top.   See, you don't always have to get pulled pork or ribs to satisfy that addiction!  Although maybe you do need the beans every time.  Well, either way you will love the food, the ambiance and the new friends you will meet here.  So get going - now!

We almost didn't go to this place because we heard alcohol is not served here... We are on vacation and like a drink with our meal. Another restaurant was a long wait, so we decided to go ahead with BBQ... SO glad we did!

It's a line order/seat yourself place, but the staff is friendly and helpful when trying to decide what to order.  In whole, we ordered several different meats.  I had the chicken bbq sandwich.  The chicken breast was so tender! And the bbq sauce is not too sweet, but full of flavor.  Loved it.  My son had the ribs and boy are they meaty!  He ordered a full slab thinking he'd be able to eat them all, but they were so full of meat, he probably could have ordered the half.  My husband had ribs and sausage. He tried my friend's ham and said if we ever come back he'd have the ham over the sausage... sausage still good, ham better.  I tried my friend's brisket and it was good as well.  It's pulled and had a different texture than I've had elsewhere, but it was still good.

They also make their own sodas. The favorite, by far, is the homemade rootbeer.  A must try if you go here!
YUM!!! I take every person who comes to town to visit to Joe's BBQ. I've been here DOZENS of times and am never disappointed. I get lunch here every birthday :-)

Comfort Food Galore! I went to Joe's for the first time last weekend and was blown away. I had the beef brisket which was lean, tender and fantastic. Joe's meat's are "Pecan Smoked" as it's clearly stated on the wall of the establishment. The mild BBQ sauce is a sweet contrast to the smokey meat...YUM! My friend and I ordered the mac and cheese and homemade applesauce for sides...again YUM! Portions are large and well worth it. I'm glad I didn't order the baked potato because they're huge and roughly the size of a Nerf football. Another great surprise was the homemade Root Beer. I don't consider myself a Root Beer drinker but the HOMEMADE Root Beer was the perfect drink to wash down my excellent meal. Try it because you'll like it. 
The next time I'm in Gilbert I'll see you at Joe's. If I'm not there I'll be across the street and the owner's other yummy restaurant.

Come early or be prepared to wait. The line often extends out the front door. It took me a couple trips to find my thing but we both enjoy the chopped brisket. My husband likes the baked potato with brisket on the side. The potato is big enough for 2-4 meals. Best BBQS we've had outside of Texas.

First time here and the food is Amazing! We had the jumbo beef brisket sandwich, half slab of ribs, mac n cheese, corn and salad. Everything tasted delicious! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely enjoyed our dinner, will continue to come back.

It's difficult to put my love for Joe's into words, but I'll try.

The barbecue is by far the best I've ever had.  The root beer is awesome, the sides are awesome, the service is awesome.  The helpings are large so it's easy to split, plus the prices are good!

This family has done SO MUCH for the town of Gilbert that it feels great to support them, but I keep coming back for the awesome food.
Meats were delicious. Yummy! The rootbeer wasn't my favorite but we weren't there for the root beer.

I've lived in every big BBQ place, from Memphis to KC to Texas. Joe's Real BBQ is the best in the valley. The more I eat here the more addicted I become. The rib meat falls off the bone. Their brisket is tender and juicy. Pulled pork is delicious, and the chicken is good. The sides are awesome, my daughter and I crave their mac & cheese!  

One day I hope to try their desserts, but I'm always too full to even look at them.

Atmosphere here is good.  Very comfortable and friendly place.
Loved it. The atmosphere is great, awesome staff as well as a great place to take your kids. Best BBQ in Arizona, I think.

Best BBQ evvvvvvveeeerrrrr!!!! I love BBQ and this place does it right. The brisket is amazing, smoked turkey, chicken, everything! I love the sides, sweet potatoes, om nom nom, baked beans, corn bread, lemon cake. Nothing here is over seasoned, it's just right. A lot of BBQ places have gone the spicy route to cover up the fact they have a bland and tasteless meat, but not these guys, I'd even eat the meat without any sauce (what?!). Another plus is they're reasonably priced, perfect for lunch time or night out with the fam.

Good lord, the sampler! This place is on top of their BBQ game! In getting the sampler, I was treated to a mountain of meat, toast and two delicious sides! I gots to break down the meats... 

The chopped pork - smokey and delicious 

The bbq chicken - juicy and loaded with sauce

The brisket - wonderfully tender and flavorful 

The ribs - OH MY GOODNESS, THE RIBS! (best of the bunch!)

On the side I had slaw and potato salad, both of which were good, but tasted pretty standard. I did get to try some of the beans and the scalloped potatoes and those were pretty legit. Oh yeah! I almost forgot that I washed everything down with homemade root beer; that complemented the meal perfectly!

I really need to go back to try the sausages there, they looked just as good as everything else, but one man can only eat so much! I'll be back though, and soon.

My family and I love this place! Joe's has it all - great food, friendly service, fun environment and decent prices. The place is one of the coolest restaurants around for families. Without a doubt, Joe's led the way for all of the other great restaurants that have come to downtown Gilbert over the past few years.

Very unique, small town atmosphere. Friendly and welcoming service. 
Free meal on your birthday.
BBQ brisket was tender and juicy. I would definitely rank it in the top for the Phoenix/West Valley/East Valley area.
Mac-n-cheese was creamy and delish. The baked beans are noteworthy - a mix of various types of beans with a bbq/smoky taste 
Prices and portion sizes are reasonable. 
I wil definitely come here again and try another bbq meat.

Some awesome barbecue here! 
I did think the prices were a bit inflated but that's pretty standard at barbecue spots. Nonetheless the food was good and I went home in a food coma!

When I want the best BBQ that can be found in the Phoenix Metro area - I head for Joe's!!  There are other places that have great reviews - but I have little patience to stand in line for hours to eat and run the risk of the "sold out" sign going up right when I get to the front door.

Joe's always has very consistent high quality BBQ!!  Their home made Root Beer is a treat too!!   Fun old country atmosphere with tractor in the middle of the dining room.

Friends, family and business  -  always great BBQ at Joe's!!!
IMHO some of the best cue in the valley I always get the BBQ sampler because everything is so good I can't decide

I've been to Joe's Farm Grill before and I loved it. I've never been a huge BBQ guy but I've always heard so many good things that I had to give this place a try. I took the wife and 3 kids and let me tell you, it did not disappoint. Excellent food from scratch and friendly service. Finished off with a picture of the kids in front of the Tractor which they loved! Great job Joe! Liberty Market is next on the list!

The meat is absolutely the star at Joe's.  That is how it should be when you go out for BBQ.  I have to say right off the bat, that for my taste, the sauce is way too sweet.  That is a personal preference so just bear that in mind.  I had the meat sampler and since I am not a chicken fan, I asked them to sub a hot link and they accommodated.  The amount of smoke flavor was perfect in the brisket. It had a great crust too and was very tender.  The ribs were falling off the bone, very meaty and delicious.  The pulled pork was also a little on the sweet side, but tender and tasty.  The stuffed baker is one of my wife's favorites.

The staff was very friendly, the service was fast and the sides were good as well.  We will be back!

I am a long time BBQ connoisseur. I participate in BBQ judging at the KC royal, and have spent a solid portion of my life in Kansas City. When it comes to good BBQ - Joe's is really your only choice in the Valley. BBQ pork, Beef brisket cannot be matched anywhere else. Now - Ribs, I can say my personal preference is not Joe's, but because they hit the mark so well in many other ways, I rate them a 5 star without hesitation.

I seriously eat here very regularly, sometimes even 2-3 times a week.  The food is always great and very consistent.  I'm not even sure exactly how they're cooking the meats but they have these giant smokers out back.  I know some of it sits in there for hours. It has a very home made down to earth family environment.  Everyone is always friendly and very helpful.  It's great food for a quick lunch or a huge get together for dinner.

I highly recommend them.

There is a lot of hype about this place but that's not the entire reason I went.  I've passed the place tons of times and it looks like a neat place that would most likely have decent BBQ.  Anyway, back to the hype.  I mean the place was on TV so it must have awesome BBQ, right?  I say wrong.

The food isn't horrible.  It is just ok when you compare it to other BBQ joints around town.  Here is what I tried.

* Ribs - These were just ok and look better than they are.  I think they were cooked too long or something.
* Chopped Brisket - This was the first time I've had chopped brisket.  It was just ok and I think I'll stick to sliced from now on.  I thought that it would be super duper tender being cooked in the sauce but it really wasn't.
* Sliced Brisket - This was pretty good.  The meat wasn't too lean which I liked.
* Chicken Breast - This was pretty good.  Very tender and tasty.  I think that it is processed meat, but I'm not positive.  If it is processed then shame on Joe.
* Cheesy Potatoes - I love cheese, I love potatoes and I love green chili.  This I did not love.  I think it needed more cheese and the potatoes should have been mashed instead of the chunks.  It was just weird.
* Mac N' Cheese - This was pretty good.  I would have liked it to be cheesier though.  I love the crunchy stuff on top whatever that is.  
* Sweet Cut Corn -   It wasn't, but it tasted canned.
