* Chocolate Chip Cookie - Pretty good.  They are bigger and thicker than normal cookies.  It would have been awesome had it been fresh.
* The BBQ Sauces - The regular is pretty good but I loved the hot stuff.  It wasn't too over the top spicy and had a good flavor.  I also like that they don't drown their meats in sauce and let you do it yourself.

The decor of the place is great and pretty unique and very family friendly.  It complements the area excellently.  The place is clean and all the workers are fast and friendly.

I am generally not a fan of the whole cafeteria style grab-a-tray-and-get-your-food thing, but I guess that is part of the charm.  The biggest bummer is that there is only one place to fill your drink and that spot is in the middle of the ordering line so it is a bit awkward should you need a refill.  Do you cut in line?  Do you wait in line?  I opted to enter the line from the wrong end and cut some people to get my refill.

I love Liberty Market across the street and would like to try the Farm Grill in the near future.  I know there is a lot of hype surrounding the Farm Grill, but I will just have to see for myself if it lives up to it or not.  Joe has a great thing going and is a top-notch restaurateur.  He cares about his patrons as I will most likely receive a message from him on here about this review.  He sent me a note after my review of the Liberty Market (which I loved) to say thank you. 

In conclusion..... 

Would I rush back?  No.  Would I ever return?  Yes.

I flew in from Hermosa Beach to hang out with a really good friend that lives in Gilbert.  

We decided to stop here after my flight, for lunch.

We walk in and this place is so freaking cute that I almost peed my pants.  I appreciate this sorta place coming from a beach city and never seeing anything like this.  Everyone that worked here was super nice.

Home made root beer was great!

Pulled pork sandwich was great!

BBQ Beans were the best beans I've ever had! 
(pinto, lima, cowboy beans) YUMMO!

Potato Salad was bland, not what I expected but whatever.

THUMBS UP!!

I can't rave about this place enough, everything is fantastic! Tender, juicy meats, scrumptious sides, HUGE root beer floats made w/home made root beer and home made ice cream, and a giant toppings bar. They're pretty quick even when there's a huge line, and portion sizes are generous. I would recommend the pulled pork and ribs in particular, but everything is great!
Good food, good prices... Great outdoor area for families. Love the atmosphere. Great location in downtown Gilbert.
Always great BBQ and consistent.  Whether we get take out or eat-in, there food is always good.  Even if a long line, it goes fast.  Don't miss out on the Mac and Cheese and cookie!!

The food is great, and you can tell the owner's really care a lot about customer service and getting out in the community. It's served cafeteria style and the line gets REALLY long around lunch and dinner so be prepared to stand for a while if you catch the rush!

I always leave here satisfied. The food's amazing. I live in Utah now, but whenever I come down to visit family, this place is on my list. I don't miss it. Try the Pork sandwich with spicy BBQ sauce, some root beer, and a piece of cake, and you're in heaven!

The building is neat, the staff is friendly, the food is okay. It's a cafeteria setting: stand in line, grab a tray, pay and sit down. Not having to tip is a plus.

I actually prefer Honey Bears, Bobby Q and Famous Dave's.

This place was very cool! The employees are some of the nicest people ever. They were so helpful with the menu and giving suggestions. The food was really good, too. I had the sliced brisket and pulled pork with sides of mac and cheese and beans. Everything was delicious! They also make their own root beer and cream soda which are amazing. I highly recommend Joe's
My wife and I visited for a late lunch. Food, atmosphere, and staff were all phenomenal. Legit delicious bbq and the homemade root beer was delicious as well. Highly recommend!

Joe's is good, but it definitely isn't the best barbecue I've ever had. I think that my expectations may have been set too high after hearing tons of rave reviews from friends. I had a meat plate with sliced brisket, turkey jalapeño sausage, and a side of mac and cheese. To be honest, the brisket and the sausage were both kind of dry, but they were good when I added more of their original sauce. Their sauce is definitely good. My mom had the chicken, which was actually moist. Between our whole party, I got to try the cheesy potatoes, mac and cheese, potato salad, and coleslaw. All of the sides were really good. The homemade root beer is also fantastic. My only real complaint is that the layout of the restaurant is terrible. I don't recommend sitting in the booths on the south side. The line to order goes right past those booths. If you sit there, be prepared to be blocked in your booth by people standing in line. It feels crowded and not at all private. Some people were watching us eat and listening to our conversation while waiting in line, and we could barely get out of the booth and past the people standing in line to leave. It just didn't make for a very comfortable dining experience.

I am not trying to be a hater of BBQ but I am going to throw my review of this place in there and most of the rating has to do with the price and would I return or not.
Pros - food is served very quickly if you are in a hurry. Corn bread is very good and you always get a piece hot from the oven. 
Cons - The home made rootbeer is not as good as A&W but you may like it more than me. The food was Meh and I love BBQ maybe again you like it more than me but I do my BBQ a little different. The bread used was average at best. The prices was 26 dollars for 2 BBQ sandwitches and 2 sides each with corn bread and 1 drink. WOW did I fall asleep and wake up at Famous Dave's? 
Comments - This is a quick serve already made BBQ place kinda like a cafe at school but with higher up prices than what you would expect. I didnt eat all my food and would not return. I am meaning to go back to give Joe's Farm grill another try but with the gift card I was given I thought I would try something else for a change. I should have got a hamburger instead. :(

Okay, I gave this place five stars because I'm not a fan of BBQ and I LOVED it here!  If a restaurant can make me love something I never really cared for, it's something special.  Joe's is now one of those places I get a hankering for.  Hmmm...speaking of which, I think I need a visit!

It's loud and rowdy and made for families.  Inside their tables are big and welcoming and outside they're picnic-style.  No worries about wiggling kids, messy hands and loud voices here.  

Like the atmosphere, the food is perfectly kid-friendly: turkey, beef, pork and chicken, in all of its various BBQ'd forms - pulled, linked, brisket, rib and breast.  The 12 and under meals are well-priced.  At $4.49 and $5.49, they're heartier than the kid's meals you'll find at most fast-food restaurants.  The homemade sides include kid-favorites like mac n cheese, applesauce and cheesy potatoes.  

Try the huge potato (jumbo baker) and when I say huge, I mean it.  It's a one pound spud heaped with your favorite toppings - plus, you can get it with BBQ, too.  Your head may say, "what?!", but your tummy will say, "thank you".  

Come to think of it, everything there is huge, like the sampler plates.  Chances are you'll walk away with leftovers.  And...on your busiest, "don't have time to cook" nights - order take out and pick it up at their outdoor window.  That's as family-friendly as it gets!

i had the pulled pork with a side of mac and cheese , sweet corn and corn bread! we were actually going to get postinos across the street but due to parking and it looked packed we figured we try some bbq! it was great everything had flavor i will be coming back

Delicious BBQ! Pulled pork bbq sandwich with coleslaw and bbq pit beans were awesome! Desserts were great as well (I've had the lemon cake and pecan brownie). Only thing missing are sweet potato fries!!

Joe's catered my wedding 2 weeks ago and it was amazing! From the great pricing to the delivery and the overall quality of the food, it was outstanding. Everyone was talking about how great the food was! Definitely check this place out!

ASTHMA WARNING: I am sad to say out of all of the Joe's places in town this is the only one that I will not be back to. My family and I had been wanting to try this place every since we first tried the terrific Ribs and Waffles at Joe's farm Grill.  We stopped by for lunch one Saturday in March or April. We were early and there was no wait  so you would expect everything to be fresh, but the mac and cheese was pretty dry and tasteless. I am sure we got a bad batch because so many people seem to like this dish. But the meat was great. I love meat so this was the most important thing to me, but I can't speak for my son. He was a little sad about the mac and cheese. 

Anyway the problem was the smoke in the restroom. I am not sure if it is always like that day or not, but I had a severe asthma attack in the restroom because the smoker seemed to be venting right into the ladies room. I didn't have an inhaler with me because I hadn't been having asthma. I had to rush to my car, not running because I already couldn't breath, praying that there would be one of my inhalers there. I didn't even even stop at the table to tell my husband what happened. I just left. Luckily there was an inhaler in the car but I wont be back to find out about the mac and cheese situation. I just would strongly advise going into the restrooms if you do have any lung problems.

I do love the whole concept and the family friendly theme though. So eat at the Farm Grill or Liberty Market if you want Joe's quality in a lung safe environment.

One of the best BBQ in the nation. The brisket is the best I have ever had. When ordering a side dish, get the baked beans. This is a great place for large groups especially when the weather is nice. They have lots of outdoor seating and a grassy area for the kids to play. Don't let a long line scare you. It moves quickly and it is worth any wait.  Joe's started the restaurant/foodie scene in downtown Gilbert.

This place is cute, but downtown Gilbert is like that for the most part. Very down to earth, friendly, and homey!

We were on this side of town, and decided that instead of braving traffic; we would just go ahead and have supper here and proceed on home at later time.

We chose Joe's Real BBQ because we heard so many good things about it. After all, both my partners live in Gilbert. And they should know, right?

When we walked in, we were greeted by a friendly hostess who introduced herself and got us acclimated to the their offerings. We were both famished, and everything seemed so appetizing.

I chose the BBQ combo (pulled pork and chicken), and my Beloved had the sliced Beef Brisket. We walked up to the counter, and that's when our experience started diminishing. It must've been a off-day in Gilbert because the cashier that took our order was none too pleasant. 

We ignored her as we walked to our table, after placing our order. We sat at one of the side booths that had a few tables. Alongside side us sat a couple that just didn't seem all that happy. As they were about to partake of their food, one of the young bussers came up to them, and cheerfully asked how their food was. 

Wrong question!

The man turned to him, and said, "If you were paying attention, you'd notice that I haven't taken a bite of the food yet. So, why don't you go to that couple over there (pointing to us) and bother them with your stupid questions!"

Well, so much our initial impressions. Now that busser was in a mood, he wasn't all that friendly and accommodating when we came over to OUR table.

This was spiraling downward faster than a falling rocket.

The piece de resistance of downward spirals was when we received the food, and mine was completely dry and tasteless, and my Beloved's Beef Brisket had some type of large congealed meat that was mixed in that was absolutely atrocious.It completed detracted from what could have been a good piece of Beef Brisket. Who knows? And we will never find out!

Needless to say, we were done at that point. The only reason that I didn't rate them a 1 was due to the fact that I have heard and read such great things about this place. Furthermore, we have never struck out this badly eating in Gilbert.

We will endeavor to eat here another time, when the stars and planets don't align to cause this unfriendly maelstrom wherein people forget to take their daily "chill pills!"

Food:  Extremely good.  Great pulled pork and about the most tender brisket I've had. Be sure to try both types of bbq sauce... the 'IDAREYOU' sauce is hot but not quite as hot as one would expect from the name... most people should be able to take it and IMO the best is probably a mix of the two sauces they offer.  Side dishes were a bit mixed... mac n cheese was flat out the best I've ever had (hope you're not on a diet for that one) and the beans were the best and most unique I've had at ANY BBQ joint (chunks of meat, peppers, and three different kinds of beans in a smokey hot mess that made me feel like a chain-smoker trying to quit when I was deciding whether or not to go and get a second helping of it...).  They are both a must try.  Cole slaw and potato salad were both a pretty big miss from my perspective, no bite in the cole slaw (we actually took some home and added some vinegar and then it was right proper) and the potato salad was also bland (it actually had an interesting spice that I had not had in potato salad before, but just not nearly enough of it.  We also had the root beer float as a shared dessert and that was fantastic.

Ambiance:  Minimal.  Cafeteria-style eating.

Service:  Employees were nice enough but totally busy.  Given that not much service is expected, this wasn't much of a big deal.  Food is prepped to-order and takes about two mintues from when you order it in the line.  When we were there a rather intimidating line of over 20 people disappeared in about 10 minutes.

Prices:  Average.  Probably $12-$14/person.

Net:  If love good BBQ and are from the area, you've GOT to try this place.  The meats are melt-in-your-mouth good, and the mac n chese and beans are must-haves.   The couple of misses on the other sides and the near-warehouse style eatery sway this from 5 to 4 stars, but if you don't care about those things, you can go there and have a fantastic meal.

This is one in the world, only can say all is amazing, food, place, service, the barbecue is more than great, the sals, but the potatoe is to die for, you can't find nothing better than these, this is an other significant about potatoe, just baked, big! wow!!! I jus have to go again!

I would have given this a higher rating except for the prices.  Ok - in this economy, I am lucky to be able to eat out at all.  However, $11 for their smallest sandwich and two small sides and a drink ($1.99 each!!) is a little pricey especially if you have a family to feed.  They should consider making it a buffet since they charge buffet prices or giving you a little more for you money.

But, yes, the food is good.

Second time here and wasn't as good as the first time. This time around... the Brisket was very fatty and the mac n cheese was dry.

Pork ribs were good. 

Please work on consistency :/

Just a followup since MH and I went there last night after Stellar Adventures - totally a snap decision but we each had had only a granola bar all day. 

Ok, so he wasn't enthused about it before but that all changed once he got a taste of the beef brisket and hot bbq sauce. More on that later. So we had the corn, mac&ch, and potato salad as sides - my favorite was the latter. However, MH felt in future he would just go for the meat. Nice bread and cornbread. Wasn't too thrilled with the honey butter - it was nice but I felt the bread was sweet enough without it. 

he really loved the sauce though. Before we left, he added more to the leftovers. Since we ate early, the second half came out at 11 or so. Imagine my surprise when he came barreling (yes, I mean this)  in afterwards, literally breathing fire at me! "My god, in quantity that stuff is spicy!" And I don't know what was in it but he was in "I can lift-you-up kick - which I haven't seen in like 9 years. Bouncing with energy! Does it confer a superhero complex on one, or what???

glad I bought a bottle - can do this experiment again ... :-)

I love this place. The food, the atmosphere (despite the cafeteria style like line - I think it sorta adds to its charm), and the atmosphere are totally on point. 

Everyone I've taken here loves it. It's just really good. I personally was won over by the bottled sodas and the cheesy potatoes. Don't get me wrong, the pulled pork is fantastic too, but you don't see bottle sodas very often, and I heart potatoes. 

It's also located in a really cute part of Gilbert which looks like an old town of somesort (forgive my ignorance, I'm a newbie here.)

This place is literally THE BEST place to go for bbq in AZ and even CA. I know, bold statement, but it's truly amazing. I usually get the sampler which includes pork ribs, beef brisket, pulled pork and bbq chicken. You can't go wrong at Joes.
OK BBQ. Pretty expensive for the serving size.

Normally I would say the takeout experience is great but tonight's was very frustrating. We asked for pints of mac and cheese and corn and when we got it home that isn't what we got. When I called to point out the mistake they apologized and said well we did charge you for the smaller size so what do you want us to do? She basically had no clue that she should have credited us or get us a gift card for the mistake. It seems like they really don't give a rip about their service. Sad!

Really wanted to love this place. Great location, excellent service, and nice atmosphere. The food is just okay.

Brisket was sort of dry, and served chopped and sauced. Pulled pork had very little flavor to it, same thing with the Chicken breast. Coleslaw didn't have much seasoning to it. The baked beans were decent. The potato salad was tasty.

Maybe I'm a BBQ snob because I've had some excellent options in other cities I've lived in. I don't think I'd go back.

Very tender meat and the sauces are very flavorful. Ordered the pulled pork and sliced brisket with pit beans. Both the pulled pork and brisket were done very well. They were incredibly tender and nowhere did I need a knife to cut since they pretty much melted on command. The meats were not smokey or salty. The pit beans were and interesting combo. I'll try a different side next time. Their sweet sauce is very flavorful. Their hot sauce really hits the spot. I couldn't decide which one I liked better - maybe the hot sauce. The only downside I could think of was the soda fountain is difficult to access since you have to climb over people in line to get a refill. They also don't let you sit on the tractor. :-(

I wanted to love this place as much as I love Joe's Farm Grill but regrettably I don't. It has a very pleasant "cookout" atmosphere and the staff are wonderful but the bottom-line for me is that the cue is not that good.  It's dry and lacks any hint of smoke.  And the sides I've tried. -- slaw, mac n cheese and baked beans -- were just ok too. I did like the house made lemonade however. Try Joe's Real if you're in the area but IMHO it is not worth a long trip.

So far, I have tried all three of Joe's restaurants: Joe's real BBQ, Joe's Farm Grill, and Liberty Market. I love them all but I think this is probably my favorite. I order the same meal here every time I go because it is just that good. Its the chopped BBQ Brisket sandwich with a side of mac and cheese and sometimes sweet corn if I am super hungry. The sandwich is huge, the meat has a great flavor, and the mac and cheese is some of the best I have ever had. I mean, come on, they crush up cheeze it's or goldfish and put them on top to make a crust. If that isn't love, I don't know what is! The corn is good but corn is corn, how bad can you screw it up? I've also had their beans before and they are really good except I am not a fan of lima beans so I kinda wish they were left out. Oh and Joe's has this great onion relish to put on your sandwich that is unlike anything I have ever tasted!!! If you are a fan of onions and you go to Joe's, you must try this stuff. 
I have also tried both types of cake, lemon and rootbeer and although they were both good, I would have to say that the lemon is the clear winner. 
The only thing I would say that I don't like about Joe's is where the drink dispensers are. Its a real pain to get a refill if there is a line. Also, you better make sure you pick up everything you will need when your going through the line unless you want to have to push past people later on to get what your missing. 
Joe's is definitely one of the best BBQ joints in the Phoenix area. Keep it up Joe!!!

This place was supremely disappointing. The water smells like a fish tank. The brisket was so salty it was inedible. The pulled pork was so overcooked there was no more discernible meat texture left, it was just pure mush. The plates are served with a really weird, soggy, very strongly rosemary herb bread, which might have been ok if it wasn't served soggy. 

And the prices were pretty high for what you get... For $15+ a plate I would expect an edible dish. 

I would have gone one star, but I'll include the extra one because the outside seating is really quaint and enjoyable.
Good BBQ, choices and family atmosphere, if not to hot you can go to their open seating area and enjoy the view of downtown
Omg.  Nom nom nom. Get the baked beans and mac and cheese with your pulled pork!

I come here when my friend visits from out of town as she loves this place. Personally I think it's just alright, but then again I am not a huge BBQ fanatic. My favorite thing here is the cornbread with the sweet honey butter! These square blocks are soft, fluffy and delicious!

A few months ago when i visited they had chicken wings that was really good. On this last visit I was hoping to get those again but I didn't see it on the menu which sucked!

Overall, Joe's Real BBQ has become my favorite "go to" BBQ spot in Phoenix (Gilbert specifically).  The prices are reasonable, the meat is always excellent quality and the sides are amazing.  Their baked beans are like candy.  This place gets very busy and a little hectic, but the food is worth the wait.  If you're living in the East Valley (of Phoenix) and you want great BBQ hit up Joe's.  You will not regret it!

I've been coming to Joe's BBQ for pretty much as long as I can remember and have never been disappointed. This is one of those things I just CRAVE. Actually, this, Joe's Farm Grill and Liberty Market are all crave-able. That Joe is doing something right, for sure.

My favorite item here is the stuffed baker. A GIANT (yes, HUGE, ENORMOUS, MASSIVE) potato is baked to perfection and then smothered in butter, sour cream, cheese and chives. Then, you choose which magnificent meat you'd like piled on top. I usually go for the pulled, but I switch it up with the chopped brisket now and then. Drench in their famous BBQ sauce and smile. This is always enough for two meals.

Everything else is awesome too. Ribs are perfect. Chicken breast is so moist and flavorful. I love all of the sides. Everything just tastes homemade and perfect. I'd have to say the cheesy potatoes are my favorite. And don't forget to try the homemade root beer. You can't go wrong here!
I'm a definite Joe's loyalist.   I love the sweet flavor of their hot BBQ sauce.  I could pour that stuff over just about anything and eat it.
Super good BBQ everything is so tender and flavorful! The beans are a must if you want to have the full experience!
Amazing food, great location!  God the BBQ chicken and it was fantastic!

Been coming to Joes for 15 + years. Had not been in over a year so decided it was time again. Had ham and brisket , wife had pulled pork. Ham and brisket excellent , pulled pork not so much. Very mushy and fatty. Sides good as usual, atmosphere always fun. Prices a little on the high side but do give you alot of food.  Overall Joes remains a solid place to eat. Sure not the best bbq in Arizona but consistent .

It is a really cool set up. The whole place is kind of like a buffet counter but the meats are amazing. You have to try the BBQ beans! We ordered at the window because we had our doggie. The window is right around the corner and there is access to the picnic outdoor area. Lovely sunday lunch!
It just wasn't that great to me.  It's fine for BBQ and the baked beans were different (in a good way) but it just wasn't up to the hype I had  heard about from so many different people.
Great brisket and BBQ chicken with really good root beer. Friendly service,and good prices.Makes it a family friendly place to eat.

Best BBQ in AZ!

Worth the drive from Phx to Gilbert just to eat at IMO

Hands down favorite BBQ in the Valley!  Love the over-sized baked potato & the pulled pork - delish!  Homemade root beer completes the meal!  I'm not a fan of the sides and I've never had room for desert but potato and pork are delicious enough to satisfy me every time.

Stopped by with a friend for lunch.  The cafeteria style set up is off putting at first but it gives you an opportunity to see what the entries look like when ordering.  Joe's is located in downtown Gilbert in an old brick building with a covered patio on the side.  It is a pretty good size place with plenty of options for seating.  The BBQ smoke smells fantastic as you enter.  I had the two meat combo (ribs and pulled pork) and my companion had a pulled pork sandwich.  Both were very good, fall off the bone ribs and moist and tender pulled pork.  Good but not great BBQ sauce options.  We had Mac N' Cheese and Cole Slaw sides which were tasty.  Would definitely stop back.
super delicious food here! The prices are somewhat reasonable but it's worth it, the Root Beer here is something that needs to drank every visit

10 years ago when we moved to Gilbert this seemed like a genuine BBQ house that had a quaint little charm to it.

Now it seems almost overly commercialized and has lost the home town feel.  The food is still better than most BBQ in AZ, but that isn't saying much.  Anyone who tells you this is tremendous BBQ has never been to Kansas City or Memphis.

Definitely a great place to take the family and get well fed, but don't expect a mouth changing experience.  They do a good job catering.

This place is just ridiculously amazing. First time I've seen a place that makes their own root beer. Everything here is so good, sides and all. Hands down to this place for making such a fantastic BBQ experience!
Pulled pork BBQ sandwich was great.  Cole slaw is excellent and beans are the best I have tasted anywhere. Dine next to a tractor!  Joe does it right!

After parking my car, I smelled something wonderful coming out of a small window in an otherwise blank wall.  If it wasn't for that, I probably would have walked by and never noticed Joe's.

We ended up getting a meat plate with chopped brisket and pulled pork.  The meat was so tender and juicy I had to spoon it up as it would almost fall off the fork.  The sauce so tangy and flavorful.  And the corn bread, unfortunately not considered a side, was absolutely fantastic.  

The best part was the ranch house style and setup of the place.
The chicken was a dry. And the cheesy potatoes were not great or recommended. But everything else was great. Had the sample plate. Get BBQ sauce on the side. Smothered is best.

5 plus stars for decor ..I am a sucker for that whole post modern retro  vintage look...  Love it. I  love the John Deer Tractor in the dining room and the old wood everywhere , I love that it still looks like a store front and has a rich red paint on the inside .I love the cafeteria style serving with the old fashioned look to it. I even adore the old retro sodas in a tin. 

But I have to say 3 stars for food . The ribs did not have the flavor that I crave  with ribs. I  see  and smell the smokiness,but there was almost too much sweetness with the overbearing sauce, it was nice but not delicious.  The coleslaw tasted like they ran down to Smart and Final and bought the big bag of coleslaw mix and the jar of coleslaw dressing ..boring and bland.  
The mac and cheese however was super  yummo. Baked with a cheesy crunchy top that made it  comfort food. I also really like the cornbread, not too sweet not too bland  and honey butter very delish. 
We also had an interesting dessert Sweet potato crunch that I am still pondering  a mash of sweet potato with a creamy texture with a bit of nuts and brown sugar. Ice Cream cut the richness . 

I want to adore Joes ,I want to say it's an all around winner . i want to sit in the restaurant and enjoy the decor, but maybe I 'll go for the cornbread. 

Hey Parents--The kids menu is a rib sandwich ...which wouldn't have been a hit with my kiddo....

THE WAIT

The first time I tried to eat at Joe's Real BBQ there was a line out the door that ended at the stoplight down the sidewalk (there was some sort of LDS convention). So I decided to try it another day since I didn't want to stand in line for 30 minutes. It took about 10-15 minutes in line when I tried this place for lunch on Saturday. So bring a book if you want to eat at Joe's.

THE FOOD

I had the sliced brisket with beans and coleslaw. This is known as the 1/2 pound meat plate that includes two sides. My wife had the chicken. They just dribble a little bit a BBQ sauce onto your meat so you have to make a separate trip to their BBQ Sauce station to get more sauce. I thought the brisket tasted ok, I have had better. The BBQ sauce wasn't anything spectacular. And the beans were just ok for me, kind of like a three bean salad cooked in a sauce. The coleslaw definitely failed. 

THE BEVERAGE

I had the run of the mill refillable soda from the machine. The problem with the refill is that you have to excuse yourself through a line of people to get to the machine. There were actually people waiting in the food line to refill their drinks. That's why I'm glad I sent my wife out on that refill mission. I can imagine the pissed off people that were thinking that you're cutting in line. So the logistics with the soda machine is a complete fail.

CROWD CONTROL

I would hate to be eating in a booth next to the line. Kind of awkward to get out of the booth to get more bbq sauce or a refill and then you have people steering (get it, steer instead of stare) at you as if you were in a fishbowl. Something needs to be done with the table configuration.

CONCLUSION

In my opinion the brisket is probably the best that I have tasted in Arizona (How I miss Smoque) but the lack of ambiance kills it for me. I would suggest you just order take out and not dine in.

We ordered take-out from Joe's for Monday Night Football.  I called in the order and actually had to call back twice to make changes, and the girls taking the order were super nice and patient.  

With a 20 minute (or so) drive home, the food wasn't exactly piping hot and the turkey jalapeno sausages we ordered had gotten quite cold and a bit rubbery.  I tried nuking them but still not that great.  It's a shame.  They are probably much better when fresh.  I will say though that the BBQ sauce is AMAZING, and both my husband and our friend absolutely LOVED the brisket.  The sides were simply "ok" (we tried the cheesy potatoes, potato salad, and mac n' cheese).

All in all, final verdict is that I will have to go back, eat the food fresh, and review again.  Stay tuned.  And in the meantime, go and have the brisket.

You have to go to Joe's Real BBQ!  I friend of mine who lived in Gilbert first took me to this place about four years ago.  Since then Joe's has become a staple.  Not only did I first meet my future husband in this restaurant but we also had them cater our wedding this past month!

The mac n cheese so incredibly good and the pit beans are super rich and satisfying.  The salad with the corn and bean relish with homemade bbq ranch is to die for.  Even after becoming vegetarian last year I still eat at Joe's for the wonderful sides and the best bbq sauce I have ever tasted.  Vegetarians can enjoy a huge baked sweet potato or regular potato (plus a number of sides like salad, cheesy potatoes, mac n cheese, applesauce, corn, etc).  A must-have is the homemade root beer.  It finishes the meal.  I also enjoy the root beer cake but my husband thinks it is just ok.  He is not much of a sweets man anyway.  The root beer cake is a unique item to try whether you are a sweets person or not.  My husband the meat-eater loves every meat he has tried there- chicken breast, turkey sausage, brisket, and pork.  He always seems to go back to the chicken and turkey sausage though.  I used to love the pieces of brisket soaked in bbq sauce before leaving the world of meat-eating.  Whatever you do savor the bbq sauce; mild or spicy are both delicious!

Thanks Joe's for always serving great food and for doing a great job of catering our wedding!  Our guests were able to go back for seconds and many kept telling me how delicious all of the food was!

There were 4 of us that ate at Joe's Real BBQ last nite.  It was absolutely the worst meals all of us ever had.  My husband had a half rack of pork ribs that he said had to have been on the grill for days. Dry wasn't the word for them.  I had a sandwich and the outside of the bun was hard and the pork was very dry.  Our friends had a bake potato with brisket on it and it looked black it was very bad and her husband had ribs and a brisket and he said the meat was very dry also.  We will never go back even if it was for free.  Shame on Joe's.  I guess we all should have taken our meals back and demanded our money.  Yuck!!!!!!!!!!!!

I am always looking for something original in the Phoenix area, and Joe's BBQ is definitely one of those few places. The food is really great (I'm generally not much of a red meat eater, but I love the brisket sandwich). The atmosphere is pleasant too, with plenty of booths and tables and outside picnic tables (or you can get takeout at the window on the south side of the building). Don't let the line scare you; it moves quickly, and if you go off hours (1 or 2 PM, even on weekends), you can find an indoor table immediately.

Be ready for very casual, cafeteria style dining.  No need to dress to impress, although I have seen multiple groups of people in evening attire at this restaurant.  I think they must go for the great food regardless of being over dressed.

Favorites: Beef brisket sliced, sweet cut corn, mac n cheese, and spicy BBQ sauce.

A delicious MUST TRY restaurant!  The pricing is a little steep, but we're all willing to pay.

Our family has been going to Joe's since it opened. From day one to the present it is consistently excellent for both the food and service. We have not found a BBQ restaurant that we like better than Joe's. Our favorites are the Turkey and Beans, both are amazing! If you have never tried this down town Gilbert gem, you are truly missing out.

Family favorite since it has opened. They have a wide selection of pecan smoked BBQ. My favorite is the bone in dark meat chicken and I like to get the potato salad in the side. They also have their own root beer which is delicious.

Love Joe's, but was really bummed on Father's Day to stand in the line (that part was fine) and be told at the counter "we're out of ribs, pulled pork and sliced brisket".  In other words...we're out of what most people come for.  I get that perhaps they were slammed on Father's Day, but we were there around 6:00 for dinner.  Disappointing, but will return!
I ate here more than a year ago, and I still remember it. This place served me the best Pulled Pork Sandwich I've had in my life. I will go back with friends as soon as we get the chance!

I love the food.  I wish they'd take the booths out along the South wall where you line up to place your order and move the drinks area so you don't have to fight the hungry people to get a refill but once you're past that, it's worth the wait.  Stuffed baker is the way to go, best of all worlds!

Wow wow wow some of the best barbecue ive had in Phoenix, this place is recommended to me by another friend and let me say the brisket is phenomenal. The brisket was moist had a bit of bark from the rub just like in Texas. I also got the turkey jalapeno sausage which was excellent , with a side of beans and potato salad both we're great favors in every bit. The sliced bread you get with every meal is awesome, they also have a sidebar were you can get pickles banana peppers condiments extra sauce etc. these folks definately Know what they're doing take a drive to downtown Gilbert check this place out

BBQ in Gilbert, AZ....hmmmm. I was skeptical at first, but this place was good.  There was a line to the door, so that was a good sign.  I decided to play it safe and get a chopped brisket sandwich and side.  It was tasty, and a I got a good portion size for the price.  The decor is done well, and they have lots of outdoor seating which we enjoyed because the weather was nice. I can see coming here with a large group and having fun at an outside table.  My side was the cheesy potatoes, and I think it was a little dry.  

Overall, it's good BBQ.  I can't really give it four or five stars because we have many places in Texas that are better, but Joe's will give you a good meal at a good price.

Just ok, a solid 3 out of 5. Brisket was dry, Bbq sauce wasn't special, Turkey jalapeno sausage about store bought grade. Pulled pork was a 4 out of 5. There famous root beer cake didn't even taste like root beer much. I had high expectations from the reviews. Maybe in Gilbert area Bbq is hard to come by?

I want to start by saying that nothing was wrong about my experience at joes. I was in town visiting and saw the reviews and thought I would give it a shot. I ordered the jumbo sandwich with brisket and pulled pork with BBQ beans without a drink. It was tasty and I enjoyed my time there but all in all I thought the price was a bit high for what it was. I think everyone should give it a chance but for me it wasn't anything to rave about as I typically would when I find a great hole in the wall.
Love this restaurant. It was one of the first locally own restaurants I can to when I moved to Arizona. Love the old fashioned atmosphere. Great food great root beer

Recently ate at Joe's for the second time and was disappointed. I love Liberty Market and Joe's Farm Grill, but Joe Real BBQ has a lot to learn from its sibling restaurants.

The food we had was pulled pork, cheesy potatoes, corn. All 3 were in order were dry, dry and soupy/flavorless.

I love some good barbeque, I hope this was an off night for the real cooks that I had the first time.

Pulled pork, homemade root beer, awesome sandwiches, and the best part is they have a pick up window for that gotta go kind of day.
So you don't have to go inside you can enjoy it at home within minutes of ordering

Solid barbeque, but I dislike having to get up for refills quite often because of their small coffee cups. I do like the cafeteria style service, but wish they would put a menu along the side of the wall because the lines are long and I feel that would expedite things. Thoroughly enjoy their root beer and corn bread.  They have an outdoor seating area, but can't really comment on that as I've never sat outside.  Also, there is a side window for carry out, so you never have to battle the crowds inside.

I cafeteria style was very quick and efficient. We went with a big group and it worked out very well. 

The food was tasty and everything was stress free. I will return and try the lemon cake next time.

Joe Johnson is such a caring man and I love how he always look after his community.  Not too many restaurateur have that type of commitment.  That being said,  I like coming to Joe's during non-peak hours so I don't have to wait in that slow moving line.  The bbq here is a hit & miss.  Sometimes the ribs & chicken are too dry other time they are good.  The 2 different sauces help it go down.  The sides are nothing special, but apple crisp dessert is worth a try.  The service is down to earth.  I really like the ambiance of this place.  Kids are allow to run as much as in the outside yard  without anyone giving you dirty looks.  The prices are good. I like bringing my out of town guest here (as long as they're not from a BBQ country)
Some of the best pulled pork sandwiches we have had! The cheesy tomatoes were beautiful. Love the area too. Go a little early, it gets busy.

The sweet tea is amazing, just like it is down south. It's a cute place with a great outdoor space. Great setting for family get togethers! The pulled pork sandwich was good but a little dry though they provide free sauce. The condiments are all available for free. The Mac n cheese has baked cheez it's on top and it's so creamy and good. The potatoes were kind of strange they had a stale after taste, my friend thinks it's the cheese which may be too sharp! The lemon cake is to die for and you get a big hunky piece of it!

Went to Joes BBQ for the first time tonight and what a major disappointment . Spent 34.$ for 2 meals , to get more fat blobs then meat, dried out cornbread and bland Mac & cheese.  The only thing good about this meal was the root beer and the polite staff.  Won't bother with this restraunt again.

The food is great! The make their own root beer. All the meat is good, but the pork ribs, pull pork and the sliced brisket are GREAT!!! Lines can get out the door. They have a to go window on the outside. Portions are small and the price slightly higher, but great taste.

This place is so good, that I got sick after eating here once and still wasn't turned off! 
( In all fairness it may have been caused by eating too much) 

The line always looks long, but waiting time is very short.

The menu isn't huge, but they make what the got WELL 

I love the picnic style outdoor seating 

It's a great family place for kids. 

Happy Eating!

All the other reviews for this place are right on the money - I think your experience will be greatly influenced by the time of day and how busy it is when you give it a try! My husband and I came in the early afternoon on a weekday; there were only three other people in the entire restaurant and we were able to take our times looking at the menu and ordering. The staff was friendly and very patient. We grabbed our food and headed to the outdoor seating (it was a nice day) and enjoyed our meal under the canopy. The meat was flavorful, but not over the top amazing. I would definitely come back here and try a few other items on the menu.

Our go to BBQ place. Cafeteria style and when busy, it's hard to find tables. Other than that, great food, great prices, great people. An AZ tradition.

Some of my favorites include the ham and turkey combo plate, beans (not just beans but also meat), the buttery corn, the mac and cheese (such a guilty pleasure) and the homemade apple sauce.  Really, you can't go too wrong with anything from Joe's.  It's good stuff!

One of my favorite places to eat.  I have enjoyed everything I have ordered, especially the pulled pork sandwiches and stuffed potato with turkey on top.  Favorite sides are the mac n cheese, beans, and applesauce.

I go here often--because I live in a house full of males.  Males that must consume honey slathered carcasses on a regular basis.

Joe's is good BBQ, can't deny that.  

But don't go if you care about variety, scene or a calorie intake.  I get the baked potato (cause it seems "sorta" healthy next to my other options).  But watch out!  Your reflexes have to be lightening quick in order to stop them from adding a pound of butter to the tater ;)  

If you feel like splurging, the classic cokes in glass bottle are a wonderful add-on.  They also have an assortment of old-style candies.

HOWDY Y'ALL!!!  I first sampled Joe's Real BBQ take out when I was at a get together at a friends house in Gilbert, and I swore to check out the restaurant next time I was in Gilbert, and I am sure glad I did!!!

Joe's BBQ is located in downtown Gilbert ... It's easy to locate due to great signage right on the corner of a block ... There seemed to be ample parking close by, which I found right away.

When you walk in its a very relaxed country style atmosphere with vintage items like a john deer tractor and an old gasoline pump - loved it!

There is ample seating both inside when you first walk in, then there was another air conditioned seating area next door, and then there was also a lot of outdoor seating at picnic tables.  It even looked like there was some corn-hole games set up outside in the grass - what a super cool fun space!!! 

If you have never been in here it may be a bit confusing at first, so feel free to ask for help as I did ;) When you order food it's done in a cafeteria like fashion and if there's a lot of people in line it's best to know what your going to get before you step up to the plate ;) 

I decided to get a large "to-go" order and I mentioned to the people helping me that this was my first time there so I may appear to be a little lost/spaced out,  The gentleman assisting everyone with their orders was very kind and patient.

I decided to try a meat plate with two meats, two sides, and two pieces of corn bread.  I went with the brisket that was chopped up, the turkey sausage, the Mac n cheese, and the BBQ beans.
 
The food was amazing despite the fact that I live about 20min away - the brisket here is awesome - very tender and with BBQ sauce it becomes the bomb.com ... The turkey sauce is very good too.  The Mac n cheese is a lil bit burnt to perfection, which I love, and WOWZA these BBQ beans are prob my fav beans of all time - no joke!  There is a bunch of stuff in these beans, and I'm not even sure of all that's in them, but they rock!  The corn bread is good, not the best I've ever had, but when you add their special butter they go from good to very good!!!

All the staff I encountered at Joe's was great and everyone was very helpful since I was a bit slow and unsure of what to order since I was a first timer.  When I left I noticed that they even had an outdoor spot on the side of the building where you could place/pick up orders, which was pretty snazzy if I say so myself ....

I would rate Joe's real BBQ a solid 4.5 stars if that was possible - the staff was pleasant, the food was veeeery good - I can't say it's the best BBQ I've ever had, but it was up there, and most importantly for the fairly large portion size I think the prices are reasonable .... Heck yeaaa Y'all I recan that I'm a Joe's fan, and I will be back reaaal soon to mack on more of that deeeeelicious brisket!!  And I would absolutely recommend others to come dine at Joe's too! ;)

text.text:
Has it really been two years since I updated my review here?  Well, I guess there isn't really much to update.  Joe's is still awesome.

If you're a vegan I think it safe to say you will find literally nothing here for you.  Everything is going to have at least some meat or dairy (cheese) in it, from the beans to the potatoes.  And there is no salad bar.

But if you're a carnivore, you have found El Dorado.

Read my previous reviews, they all still apply.  Pecan-smoked meats.  Very flavorful.  They have a sauce you can use but you really don't need it.  The meats are good without it.  The BBQ beans should be their own food group.  They are "wow", and should probably generate a bonus star here on Yelp, but we can't do 6 stars.  The other sides are good, too, and their lemon cake is excellent.  Even their homemade root beer is really good (yes, they make it themselves).

I have tried several other BBQ places in the city, and some were good.  But none are a match for Joe's Real BBQ.  Plus Joe's is locally owned, not a franchise.

Great food and atmosphere. Wait times are way too long. Get there early and prepare to wait.

They also no longer have Coca Cola products but this cane sugar Cola. It is fine but left me dissatisfied.

By far one of the best BBQ places I've been to. Had the BBQ sampler plate with a side of cheesy potatoes and it was awesome. Also their homemade root beer was some of the best I've had. Will go back if whenever I visit the area!
Incredible food!! I recommend splitting the BBQ Sampler with a friend. We ordered an extra side of meat with it.

The Best BBQ in the East Valley, I've been here several times and ordered many different items and have never been disappointed. Food is wonderful and the people are great. I love the picnic atmosphere outside when the weather is nice. I normally get the sampler plate and it has been divine each and every time. A must when in the East Valley.
Pretty good food, fun to take friends from out of town, typical rustic decor.  Not as cool as some locals seem to think, but fun.

Joe's BBQ has been around for a long time.  If a restaurant has been around for a long time you know they have to be doing something right!  It is good home cooking BBQ.  I am a fan of the Jumbo Sandwich which is 2 meat sandwich.  I recommend the Chopped Brisket (which is amazing) and the pulled pork.  For a side the Mac n Cheese is the one to choose with a homemade soft fall apart cookie.  There used to be long lines but since downtown Gilbert has blown up with new places you have no worry about waiting to get a good meal.  If you are in the east valley and want BBQ check out Joe's.

BrandonFitFoodie

I would have taken a picture of my food, but it was so good i never took a break long enough to do it.  When their sign said "homemade root beer + ice cream = best float ever"; they wernt lying.  My only issue is i live in central phoenix; well worth the trip. Maybe i should move closer.

Down home cafeteria style good ol Texas bbq! The stuffed baker was very filling, chopped brisket was flavorful & moist. Be sure to save room for the blueberry bourbon cheesecake. It's both salty & sweet & completely worth it!

I really liked this place. First, I walked in, and I noticed how clean the location looked. I was impressed. You take your food  to the table, which I liked. To me, it is better than waiting on a  waitress, or waiter to come  take your order. You grab a tray, get a drink from their delicious soda fountain, or you can grab a bottled soda/water, then you  go thru a very fast moving line.   I was impressed with the courteous guy who was getting my order ready this afternoon. He gave me service with a smile! :) Fast forward to the food...beyond delicious!! I loved everything I tried. I was so tempted to order a dessert, and I was too full to try it this  time. They all looked delicious!!  The portions are large, and very filling.  This is a great location that is good to bring the entire family. I feel the prices are great,  and the customer service is even better. I  will be back soon.
Super endroit pour manger des ribs! Une sorte de cafet familiale sans prise de tête. On a payé 25$ pour 2 et on a mangé laaaaaargement assez de ribs sauce barbecue. A s'en lécher les doigts!

The turkey is very good and tender, the BBQ sauce is good and the sides are good but for a BBQ place, the portion sizes are SO SMALL! When you go out for BBQ you expect to indulge but you will not get to do that here unless you order a double portion.

Stay away from the Brisket. Everyone here is nice, the service is good, and they generally have excellent food. STAY AWAY FROM THE BRISKET. The Brisket has a gaminess beyond beefy flavor. The Brisket absolutely tastes like manure. I love bbq but could not swallow the brisket.

The experience is fun, nice for kids to play outside by picnic tables.  The food just does not impress me at all.  It is edible and tastes okay but there is no wow factor at all.  I think we watch the food channel too much and I am hoping for a really amazing BBQ experience.

The mister and I eat out way to much and have been frequenting the same places recently.. China Chile and Joe's Real BBQ have both been visited 3x each over the past 3 weeks.. okay so we're not as imaginative as we could be. The thing is that we have turned our friends on to these places and every time they go well, we get invited. 

We just love Joe's.. it's a combination of elements, decor, pricing and comfort. This place is like that great pair of sneakers you have, a very good fit. 

I almost always order the same thing.. pecan smoked ribs, mac 'n cheese and share a loaded baked potato to share. The ribs are meaty and plentiful.. not like those anorexic bones they serve at some other places.. I'm a big eater and can never finish them in one sitting so a full slab can easily be shared. Mac and cheese there is really good even better then my home cooked version.. seems to me I have some practicing to do in that department. 

They also have this bbq ranch dressing for their salad that's a must try. Though who wants to eat a salad when there are some many good meats there to try. Their bbq sauce can be kind of sweet if you like that.. I'm a EOE (equal opportunity eater) and love all sorts of smoked meats and sauces but I know plenty of people who don't like that kind of sauce.

No table service here either, strictly cafeteria style. So be sure to have someone in your party squat a seat before ordering if you see a good table.

It's rare I give 2 stars to a place, so let's break it all down:

1. The meats did not seem fresh 
2. The place was not very clean
3. The service was OK but hectic
4. I GOT FOOD POISONING!

This place is crazy popular and for the life of me I do not understand why except maybe location?

I won't ever go back here again...

The meat tastes bad as in going bad... I was super hungry and ate it anyway. A couple hours later I lived in the bathroom for about 24 hours on and off and in bed the rest of the time....

Loves me some BBQ! If you love it like I do ,Joe's a great choice. I'm putting it down on my top 15. Joes celebrating their 20th anniversary this year, and can understand why. The BBQ is top notch. There are all the favorites. I judge all BBQ places by the brisket. It was as tender as a baby's... if you get my  drift. Pork, chicken, brisket, ribs(yum),and sausage. A huge selection of sides. Try the brisket bbq baked beans. To die for. Friday night was really busy. We got there at 4:30 and got right in. By 5:00 yikes! Line out the door. Joe's I'd cafeteria style like a lot of BBQ places. The line moved very quickly. Large outside dining, and a band. " Nobody goes there anymore, it to crowded". Yogi Berra. Just kidding. Love this place. A Gilbert jewel.

We used Joe's to cater our wedding. The food was fantastic and a great price. We emailed and went in many times and each time, the manager we spoke to was always pleasant. I am so glad we had Joe's cater! We paid for an employee who actually helped serve at the buffet! Easily one of the best decisions we made

Smack them lips!
Definitely worth a try for any BBQ lover. We had the sampler plate which allows you to try a variety of finger licking goodness (the pulled pork was sub par). The homemade root beer is excellent.

The BBQ here is pretty amazing. One of the best Arizona has to offer that's for sure. You'll be satisfied with anything that you order here. I only come here once or twice a year though, and only when they offer the sweet potato with cinnamon butter. They offer it during the first week of November I believe, and it's definitely worth it. The potato is HUGE and delicious. 

Service has always been excellent.
This is a great BBQ place to eat. It's one of those unique - reasonably priced places to take guests.

Really dig this place.  We didn't know exactly what to expect and love that this is kind of a throwback to the old school.  Grab a tray and a drink and work your way down the line for the best BBQ I've had in a long time.  The chopped brisket cooked in sauce was incredibly good and so were the baked beans.  The outdoor seating with a view of downtown Gilbert is a really nice touch as well.  We'll be back for sure!  Definitely worth a stop if you're checking out Gilbert.

It's excellent BBQ and has become my go-to bar-b-que joint in the Phoenix valley. The format is the same as any BBQ place in Texas, Oklahoma or Tennessee so that will be familiar to lovers of smoked brisket, pork or hot links. 

Highly recommended.
This place is amazing. Cafeteria style food service but some of the best BBQ ever! You might want to bring a bib.

I try to eat here when I am in town visiting my brother.  As others have said it's cafeteria style so you may have to wait in line but hopefully not for long.  This place is so good.  Their bbq is delicious, but what I found myself endlessly shoving in my mouth was the hot link sausage and the cheezy potatoes.  The inside has a nice country atmosphere with a big tractor inside.  I prefer outside at night with the strung up lights that give it, idk, just a real homey country type feel that makes the food taste even better.  Try it.  I wish we had bbq this good in San Diego.  Phils is ok in San Diego but Joe's is better hands down.

I go for the HOMEMADE root beer. I grew up on chili dogs and A & W root beer floats. These take me back to summertime in Illinois. Free refills on the root beer makes it a meal in itself. The husband loves the oversize baked potato with the salt rub eats the entire potato, stuffed with BBQ, cheese and sour cream. Our friends had a resort wedding and the best part was the rehearsal dinner at Joes!
Yummy!!! I like the hamburger! Great food, wonderful service! It offers reliably tasty, reasonably priced food. It's not the best barbecue I've ever had, but it's quite good. BBQ sauce is excellent.
Great place to eat and and socialize.  Nice outdoor area with cornhole and hula hoops. Reasonable prices and excellent food. Great for kids, too!

My favorite BBQ place yet in the valley. The meats are smokey with a very nice bark and smoke ring. This place is sort of cafeteria style so be prepared. I prefer to order at the outside window and take it home.
Overall, really really good BBQ!!!
Had the sampler platter with mac n cheese and cheesy potatoes.... the ribs by themselves are a solid 4.32 butttt everything else was average at best... just ur avg BBQ joint

Best BBQ in the Phoenix metro area. The home made red cream soda and home made root beer is amazing. All the meats are tasty. The home made BBQ sauce is great. My favorites are the pulled pork, potato salad, chocolate chip cookies. There are lots of seating and very family friendly. If you live in the PHX metro area and you havent been to Joe's, I dont know what you have been doing with your life.

Brisket is awesome 
Ribs can't be beat
Sides are lack luster 
But a great place overall.

Top notch.  By far best barbeque sandwich possibly ever.  LOTS OF MEAT. Just the right amount of sauce. You can  get half and half and try two different meats on a sandwich.   Definitely a carnivore or cave man diet HOT SPOT. I'm anxious to have the time to sort down and try the rest of their menu.  I'm sure I won't be disappointed if that MAGNIFICENT SANDWICH is the standard there.  I was pleased all around.  Great vibe.  Real casual and relaxed.

So much food! So much BBQ! My stomach can barely contain itself from the BBQ goodness. Such a great price for good food.

Got the meat plate with the beef brisket and pork ribs with a side of corn and cheesy potatoes. The BBQ sauce was nice and tangy and the meat just fell of the bone. Brisket was a little on the dry side, but that's not a problem when you can drench it in more sauce. Add a side of their pickled onions and it is just yummy yummy in my tummy.

The trick is to come when they are about to close. They want to get rid of whatever they have left so they will give you much bigger portions. This can be a drawback if you wanted a certain item because they might be sold out for the day. I really wanted to try their mac n cheese, but it's a risk I am willing to take for more MEAT!!!

I love BBQ and this is NOT just your average BBQ by any stretch of the imagination. My personal favorite is the chopped brisket or the pulled pork. There's just not one thing on the menu that I don't just swoon over :)

Thanks Joe! Now of only I lived closer. Hmmmm...

So this time we ordered in bulk for a backyard wedding rehearsal dinner.  we had ordered the brisket and pulled pork and cole slaw by the pound.  Unfortunately, while we were at the rehearsal, the dog tried ALL of the brisket (and amazingly left the rest untouched) so I can't tell you how it was.  But the rest was great as always!

Totally love Joe's BBQ. I was there for lunch a couple of days ago and had the combination platter, it was the BOMB I think that this plate should be on everyone's bucket list. The Brisket was tender and moist, the ribs were great and the chicken and pulled pork were excellent. I'm getting hungry right now just thinking about it.

They have a great spicy BBQ sauce that I smother my Q' in. 

Great stuff!

Had lunch here yesterday.  It's a cafeteria-style deal.  I got the 1/2 lb meat plate with 2 sides.  The brisket was fatty, the ribs were kinda dry, the baked beans were ok, the cole slaw was swimming in mayo and the corn bread was just a big question mark.  WTH was that bread?  Then, just to make things suck that much more, NO BEER available.  Cmon man, what kind of BBQ joint doesn't sell beer?  I'm from New England, we don't know too much about BBQ in general but this place had mediocre written all over it.

Joe's is the best option for BBQ in Arizona (valley) that I've had...  However it doesn't compare to a few of the best I've had in Texas BBQ or Kansas City stuff...  Sorry!  Joe's a cool dude and I appreciate what he does here locally and with his other places nearby but I do like coming here and will continue to do so.  It's locally owned and that's worth my biz.

Home made root beer is pretty good but not my fav.  Slaw is really good, kudos there, as is the mac-n-cheese w/ crusty top.  Beans are key and they're good here as well.

Brisket is above average and the BBQ sauce comes a little thin in my opinion but after you pick up your tray there's a spot where you can add as much as you want. Pulled pork is exceptional and more so what I lean to when coming here.  The chicken is good too.

Swing out and sit down.  If you've had The Salt Lick or similar in Texas you won't be blown away. But if you've never had good BBQ this will blow your socks off.

Sampler chicken very tender, the pulled pork really nice but the beef [is it brisket?] was a mystery meat.  The pork spare ribs were good but the cartilage was troublesome.  Potato salad and mac-n-cheese good. NIce rosemary toast.  Oink Oink.

Incredibly FAST service.

Lots of pretty girls here - eating.

No suds :(
Great food and great service. Sits in a wonderful location in downtown Gilbert. Staff is very friendly almost too friendly but I would recommend you check this place out.

We came across this place while on vacation and decided to try it out. We had a little bit of a wait in line to order at the counter. Luckily we weren't starving so it wasn't an issue. There were a lot of great BBQ options to choose from. I had the meat plate with mac and cheese, and did the chicken breast. It was really flavorful and a lot of food! My boyfriend had the meat sampler, which he really liked because he got a little bit of everything, with the cheesy potatoes side. We sat outside, which was a nice outdoor dining area and very enjoyable. We would definitely go back again. The service was fast and friendly despite waiting in a long line. The Manager or Owner (not sure which) even came around talking to everyone dining making sure everything tasted good and was super friendly.

The location and atmosphere are fun but the food is just mediocre to me. I'm not sure what all the buzz is about and why there is a line out the door almost constantly. Maybe I'm just ordering the wrong things but the food really doesn't seem to be something extra special that I couldn't make at home.

Being from Michigan and Arizona, I know my BBQ....what of really? Ok fine...I have never had good bbq....BUT

Joes does it right...quick, tasty and priced right. 

The pulled pork sandwich appeared to be lacking meat on the over sized bun but once into it it felt just fine!

The sauce was good and had a great flavor. 

The side of beans were killer with hunks of meat and veggies...YUMMY

The mac and cheese was the surprise standout for me. Usually it is just good but this was great. Nice crust on top and nice blend of cheeses. 

Go early for lunch and you can zip right through the lines.

Arrived at 5:45pm on a sat nite, and escaped the long line that started forming 15 min later. By 6:15, line was out the door and down the side street. Rustic, clean, friendly, and delicious food. Baked beans and applesauce (homemade) were our favs. Laid back Gilbert made us feel like we were back home in Nebraska. Ate our meal outdoors on picnic table. Very family friendly.

Best BBQ in the state of AZ hands down. The ambiance of this place is very old town feel. Tractor set up rt in the middle o the restaurant. The food is delicious. I had the 3 meat combo with loaded baked potato and literally everything was perfect. A great place to take the family for some quality Q. A lot of seating with a huge outside seating as well. I will come to this place every time I am in Gilbert, AZ.
Cool ambience with a real small-town vibe. The brisket sandwich was fantastic and the Mac is worth the calories, but you know this place deserves your patronage because they have Boylan soda on tap.

We went to this place, from the opposite side of town because a good friend recommended it to us. The ribs were a little burnt and dry. The pork was good but nothing extraordinary. It might have been just a bad cooking day, but it's hard to justify the drive all the way there just to give them another chance.

Best BBQ in AZ! Always satisfied with their food and attentive service. However, it is very inconvenient that the soda fountain is in the line, so it's hard to get refills on drinks. Other than that, I am satisfied every time I go!

I'm such a fan of this establishment.  As quirky as it is it is equally delicious.  The bbq Baker (a huge baked potato topped with meat, cheese and sauce) is a favorite of mine.  I like the pork and the beef brisket. Joe's is known for their sides.  I haven't tried them all.  People rave about their Mac and Cheese.  Their beans are amazing.  The root beer cake is so good!  The homemade root beer is minty and spicy.  Their chocolate chip cookies are the best ever.

I was first introduced to Joe's years ago when I worked near Coolidge and, when getting burnt out, would need the occasional three-hour lunch. It was great then and is still a worthwhile stop when I make it out to the east valley. Going down the strip that is downtown Gilbert, it's funny to see our CenPhx favorites -- Joyride, Postinos, et al -- right there. It probably wouldn't translate as well, but I sure would love to see a Joe's in non-airport Phoenix. 

My personal recommendation is the stuffed baker. All the menu items are great (really just some various combination of the bbq items that highlight the menu) but I like the baker because, hey, there's nowhere else I dine that I order the baked potato entrees (seriously, check my lists -- you'll see no 'Best Baked Potatoes in Phoenix' here!).

Always a tip of the hat to Joe's service and atmosphere. Just a great restaurant and I highly recommend giving it, at least, one shot.

Really nice lunch atmosphere. Great place to bring kids since they have a grassy area for them to play in and picnic tables for everyone to sit at. The bbq meats are amazing however the sides are just ok. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be frequenting this lunch spot more often.

So, I have been to Joe's before, and Liberty Market and enjoy both. This experience I was quite un-impressed. I had never done "to-go" with Joe's. I called in the order after looking at the menu online. I tried to order a chicken sandwich. She said, OK, what cheese, so I told her to add pepper jack cheese. I asked to add avocado. Oh, we are out. Ok, that's fine. Does it come with a side? No. Can I add a side. Sure. I wanted to add garlic fries. We don't have that. OK, what do you have? Maybe I was confused about their to-go process?? She rattled off what I could get to-go so I add chips. When I got to the to-go counter outside, I didn't see any of the sides I originally wanted, so makes sense, I think the sides are different with the to-go. Well, the sandwich came and I saw the chips so I figured everything was fine. We were downtown Gilbert to listen to music so we took our food with us. When I sat down to eat, no cheese, and no napkins of any kind. Just the chicken with the bun, and chips. I thought for what I paid, there would be something other than that? Anyways, won't do to-go with Joe's anymore.

Good selection of meats and big potatoes.   Flavorful BBQ with onions and pickles you can freely add.   Meals for around $8-11.   Free b'day meal up to $10.   Thanks Joe,  you rock!   Homemade root beer and cakes.   Old fashioned candy you can buy.   Large back yard,  fenced in  area for kids to run around after.   Great family place.

Had to pick one star,  this place deserves a 0 star rating.  Easily the worst bbq I've ever had,  all the meat was dry and the chicken tasted like kerosene.  The dinner cost me 20 bucks. I'd rather buy a bullet and put it into my skull before I eat there again.

Awesome barbecue!  Better than anything in California!  Brisket and ribs are the best!  I'm not a bean person however the Bbq beans are also amazing.  If you're in the neighborhood and slightly like bbq you must eat here.

I know that my review might be rare. If you read most of the reviews, you will get great reviews.  I have been here twice with my wife and I still have come to the same conclusion. Here is what we had to eat:

My wife had the pulled pork sandwich and I had the Brisket sandwich. It comes on a homemade bun. The meat is pretty dry, not much liquid, and by that I mean wet sauce on the meat. The bun is so thick, that when you take that bite, it feels like you have so much bread, along with a gob of meat, its hard to chew. It just might be me, but I like a wet BBQ sandwich, I need moisture. That being said, you can get extra sauce, as much as you want, its help yourself. I had a ice-cream scoop of the "Mac-n-cheese" and the cheesy potatoes. The mac is good, but I like a creamy, cheesy  Mac n cheese. This is kind of dry as well. The cheesy potatoes are just cubes of potatoes with cheese, real plain. My wife had the cornbread, and also, very plain. The place it self is kind of cool, rustic, laid-back. My one complaint is, your beverages are "Self-Serve" but to get to the drinks, when its busy, the line to order your food blocks access to get your refills. I don't like to have to squeeze in and say excuse me to everyone waiting to order and they too are filling their drinks as well, so you can get dirty looks, like you are cutting the line. They have great home made root beer, me and my wife shared a tall root beer float, very nice. My guess is, if you understand my review, then this might not be a place for you, BUT, as you can see, MANY people are just fine with food like this, so..... Its all in your hands!!! I have to give this place a .........Doh!

We're from TX and finding good BBQ when we moved to AZ was really challenging. This place is hands down the best we've found. My ONLY negative: no beer. Would love to enjoy a cold Shiner with some BBQ but it's not a deal breaker by any means. Highly recommend.

The only decent BBQ joint in town. This is what I consider to be classic Gilbert eating. Its in the heart of "downtown" Gilbert (hahaha) and everyone has eaten here at least once. 

I took the boyfriend because he's a huge carnivore. This place has huge paintings on the walls and you can even spot real cowboys if you're lucky!! Its a great place to bring your kids. 

The buffet style eating can be a bit confusing, and you might feel rushed to order so you don't hold up the line. However, the ribs, pulled pork, homemade applesauce, gigantic yam, and homemade root beer we ate were all delicious. They give generous portions of the sides, a bit less generous on the meat. 

You MUST come here at least once if you're in town. (Unless you like alcohol and in that case be sure to drink somewhere else)
Always good. The Mac & cheese is amazing. The baked beans are amazing. Not a fan of the root beer, it's very sweet like bubblegum.  Not a fan of the bread. But all the BBQ is bomb!
I'll eat Joe's any day of the week. Great food selection, and everything tastes super fresh. Must see if you ever come to Arizona.

Best BBQ in the world.  Have been a monthly visitor for 14 years and is my favorite and a gold
by which we measure all other BBQ.
THE BEST BBQ. I love this place and can't believe it only has 4 stars. I eat here every time I home. Best baked beans ever. And I love the ribs and pulled pork sandwich.

Friday night date night and we ended up here, since the smells and sound of BBQ were too good to pass up. The line was quite long but only took about 15-20 minutes to get through. The set up is cafeteria style where silverware, trays, plates and drinks are first and you order next. My boyfriend got the meat platter but unfortunately, they were out of chicken and ribs! So it was a double order of chopped brisket and pulled pork. I ordered the 2 meat platter with turkey breast and jalapeño sausage. Sides we got were mac and cheese, cheesy potato, coleslaw, and potato salad. A piece of garlic/Texas toast comes with the meal and corn bread is $2.50 extra. Total with drinks was under $30, not bad for all the food we got! BF got the homemade root beer, which he loved! It does have quite a root beer kick though, from what I was told (I don't like root beer). 

Seating is a plenty here, including outdoor seating. We picked a booth inside and started chowing away. The BBQ sauce was nice, it was tasty on the pulled pork and turkey. Surprisingly, my favorite meat was the jalapeno sausage, and I am NOT a fan of spicy things! It had just the right amount of spice and the sausage was unreal. Favorite side of the night (agreed unanimously) was the coleslaw! It was SO fresh, crunchy with a touch of sweetness. I swear I could eat an entire bowl of it. Mac and cheese was OK, cheesy potato was OK, potato salad was OK. The toast is nothing special, next time I will try the corn bread. 

Overall, we liked the food and would return. I probably won't go on a weekend again so we can actually try the food we want before they run out and avoid long lines. We will be back!

I have been here several times in the last 10 years.  Each time is as good as the last one.  The chicken, turkey and beef are excellent.  Not too salty, but tasty.  The sides (especially the cole slaw and potato salad) are simply delicious.

The root beer is brewed on the premises and is worth the trip alone.

It was my first time going here in all the years I have lived it AZ ( over 20 ) and I thought the food was AWESOME. Very tasty , I thought the portions were good and very reasonable priced. I really am impressed with this place and will go back again!

One of our favorite places to eat! Fun atmosphere for the kids and consistently delicious food. Somewhat expensive, but not outrageous. I can't say enough good things about Joe's BBQ! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place! Mmmmm!

27AUG16  a joyful day, indeed.  I had joined two friends for a birthday celebration earlier in the week and was quite satisfied with all the "ingredients" @ Joe's Real BBQ.  First, the whole city area is old, small town-ish and very tidy. The tractor at my table had a pristine green paint-job.
Since it was my BD I decided to go again for the terrific food and pleasing ambience, but also for the $10 birthday gift credit.  My name is Frugal Francisco and I'm delighted to go back to JR*BBQ and pay full freight.  Terrific food at a price to attract a tightwad like me. 

 Stay the course

PS I gather that there is connected ownership ~ Liberty Mkt where I got comp'd a super High CALorie decadent dessert.  I wish I could turn 72 again and again and A.........

Joes is a unique down town Gilbert establishment. Every time I go I get ribs and pit beans. Oh those pit beans, songs of love could be written about them. I truly love their ribs as they are meaty and flavorful. 

The last two times I've gone have been a real bummer. A friend got a pulled pork Sammy and it was dry and not flavorful. 
Yesterday my kids had their birthday and Joe's gives $10 in free food to celebrate. One kid got a chicken sandwich and the other the pulled pork. Sadly, both were very VERY dry. We went just after noon so it's not like it should suck but it did. 
Mr. Joe Johnston, please address this as I'm sure I'm not the only one noticing this and while I'll be back for ribs, I wouldn't count on others returning.

Good bbq! The meats are tender and delicious! They have two sauces, sweet and hot. You can get the sampler, which comes with a little bit of everything (ribs, chicken, pulled pork, turkey) and 2 sides. I often get the two meat plate, which is a half a pound of two meats and 2 sides. Their drinks are $2.59 and have refills. I like their sweet tea, lemonade, and orange cream soda. They have a variety of sides to include macaroni and cheese, potato salad, cheesy potatoes, corn, loaded baked potato, chili, salads, and beans. My favorite is the macaroni and cheese. we had to add salt and pepper to the beans, potato salad, cheesy potatoes, and corn because they were a bit bland, but after that "help" they were much better. The macaroni and cheese needed no assistance. On the weekends they get super crowded and the line can be out the door, but they move rather quickly. Also they have a pick up window outside where you can either call in an order and pick it up, or walk up to the window and wait.

To avoid having to read my overall review I condensed it into a simple poem for those who want to save time:

There is a barbecue by a man named Joe,
severely overrated this place simply blows.
Sandwiches served look ran over by tractors.
small portions presented adds to its bland factor.
A favorite of the elderly, "Great BBQ!" they said,
I can understand why though, their taste buds are dead.
Overpriced  and low quality there are other places to go,
Porkopolis I recommend their bbq is the show.


This barbecue is tremendously overrated.  I found myself doubting that the food wasn't mediocre because of the strong reception-- convinced I was experiencing the brunt of a disgruntled employee. I gave it another go. I found myself in front of a smashed sandwich that looks like your fat friend sat on it, covered carelessly by sub-par meat slop, complemented by two tiny sides that I meticulously ate with tweezers.  You get a free meal on your birthday though, the only time you get a bargain!
