Although Joe's fails to deliver here, he does have a hit at the sister site Joe's Farm Grill.  Amazing place.  If you want good BBQ check out my review of Porkopolis.

Till next time.

Joe's BBQ is a great place to go if you have a large group.  I love the idea of skipping service and just ordering your meal and filling up your own drink.  Great beans, chopped brisket, and a topping bar.  Big fan of the giant baked potatoes they serve and the staff always has a great attitude.  They have good BBQ sauce, both mild and hot.  A fantastic onion relish, pickles and peppers round out the condiment bar.

My biggest complaint is the location of the drink station - it is a full blown salmon run to get your refill (minus the bears of course)!  That is because the drink machine is smack dab in the middle of a long line so you have to fight through a slew of people to get that refill.  Every time I visit I try to imagine a worse location for the drink station, defeated I leave having to concede they won with their current pick.  If you have small children I would advise sending them to get your refill, they will receive less dirty looks and can swiftly navigate between the sea of legs.

Hands down the best BBQ in Arizona! Everything is fresh and cooked perfectly. Being from the south we know good BBQ, and Joe's has been the best we've found in Arizona! When we have guest from out of town we always take them there for dinner.

Gone downhill.  No one came out the entire time we were there to clean tables and the birds were so obnoxious.  Had the tables been clean I'm sure it would have been a much better experience. I was with my 4 year old grandson and they never gave us barbecue sauce.  I couldn't leave the food to the birds to go back in so we never had the sauce.  Not even a person to flag down to ask.  This is the second time in a year I went and the tables were full of food and the drink cups were all over the ground.  There should be a rule that every fifteen minutes someone goes out to check.  It was a mess. Or, give people a place to put their garbage.

Great affordable BBQ! I had both the pulled pork and the beef brisket. The pulled pork was excellent, especially when you add the spicy BBQ sauce on top.  The beef brisket was a bit on the dry end but still tasty none the less. If you're a root beer fan, definitely try their home made root beer.  It a little bit taste like Barq's root beer, but has a tad more bite to it.  Great drink to wash down your throat.

Great BBQ! I love that if its your birthday they serve your plate on them! The chicken and brisket is always so moist!! Good stuff!!! those cheesy potatoes are
Amazing!!

I wanted to love Joes, I just was not that impressed. Food was not bad, but it was not that great. There are a lot of better options. 

Did not enjoy how difficult it was to get refills. You have to fish upstream a line of starving beast to get to the soda machines. 

Probably would not come back. 

Love all his other reteraunts though!

Being from the South, I am familiar with many styles of BBQ, but rarely eat Southern BBQ outside of the southern states because it is difficult to locate great BBQ the way I like it. At Joe's I found BBQ heaven! I ordered the meat sampler which had brisket, ribs, pulled pork, and a chicken breast and wing. The brisket was fork tender, falling into pieces. The pulled pork was some of the best west of the Mississippi! I am saving the ribs and chicken to eat tomorrow. The pit beans were perfect in texture and taste with just the correct amount of meat and sweetness. Wow. The side salad with the home-made dressing was nice and light. I hate root beer and decided to try their home-made root beer. It was divine. Run and grab dinner at Joe's!

pros: cheap, nice decor, pork had nice flavor, potato salad decent, good selection of drinks and desserts, outdoor seating 

cons: beef dry, chicken very dry, ribs small (St. Louis style), no bottles of sauce on table? strange, couple of the workers may need some training in customer service

i would give them 3.5 stars if I could. 4 stars just because the prices are good (compared to where I'm from)
We come here every year for my birthday! I look forward to the food and atmosphere. The sauce is great on everything!

We frequently attend the Hale Theater just around the corner, but this was out first time here after listening to others rave about the place. I had the two meat, two side plate and some coffee. To me there was nothing wrong with the food but nothing special. Not large portions.

I am not a fan of walk up and order joints and if I had realized that this was the case here I doubt if I would have visited. Luckily we arrived at 5:10 pm on a Tuesday night and the wait was only a half hour to order and pick up our meal. While we were eating I saw that by 6 pm the line was out the door and about a dozen or more were waiting outside. I'm guessing you were looking at close to an hour of standing to order if that was you at the end if the line. Seriously, it's just not worth waiting that long to get average food. Give me a sit down restaurant any day.

BUT, the prices are low so this MIGHT be a good reason to go with a large family. You can see from many other reviews that this is a very popular place though so I suggest if you have the TIME you might give it a try.

I love Cue' and really like the pulled pork and brisket platter.  I met the owner and liked his dedication to good BBQ.  It's great for lunch.  We were in and out in 45min and ready for a nap!  Comfort food and warm weather do that!  BBQ baked beans were my favorite side.  The tea didn't taste like the sweet tea I'm used to but it was good!  I'll be back!

Joe's Real Barbecue is one of my family's favorite places. Great for groups, dates, kids, the grandparents, you name it. The atmosphere is strictly casual, with long picnic tables and plastic silverware. There is a big outdoor seating area we especially like, and if the kids finish before us they can run around in the grass without bothering anyone.

Go with the the pulled pork / sliced brisket combination with cole slaw and mac and cheese. Although everything I've tried here is good. The cheese bread is also especially tasty.

Oh, and how can I forget the lemon cake? Sweet and tangy, just like my Mom makes :)

I am giving it a 3 because the atmosphere made up for the food. I enjoyed the small town feel and the way it showcased old west arizona.  I enjoyed the old country music playing.  
Now for the food. It was alright.  The reviews here made it sound better than it was. I enjoyed the mac and cheese and the cheesy potatoes. I also enjoyed the root beer a lot. The meat was so so. The chicken was dry but had a good flavor. The ribs were good. It was pretty mediocre but nothing better than any chain bbq place.  I live in the west valley and wouldn't be making a special trip over here for it but if I was back over here I might try it.

I visited twice.
Once for a birthday discount,
and once just because.

First time, food okay.
Chicken was fantastic, but
the brisket was dry.

I loved their sauces
as well as the side dishes.
Creamy mac and cheese.

Second time, food bad.
Got the sampler plate again.
Brisket was still dry.

And so was pulled pork.
Side dishes were consistent,
but meats were just dry.

Wish I could love this,
but quality of the meat
varies day to day.

Ten dollar discount
is a great time to sample
the meat offerings.

My fav BBQ place! You can't beat the loaded baked potatoes and pulled pork sandwiches. Also, root beer cake and gourmet bottled soda. I love taking the kids and big groups here since they have great outdoor seating and lots of big tables.

Joe's is about as pretty as a picnic basket in the grass! They have a wonderful pastoral outdoor seating area. The inside is redneck delux. Big Long Booths, soft lighting and a John Deer Tractor. 

I always get the Pulled Pork Sandwich or the pecan smoked turkey when I come here. They make really good Beans and the cheese potato thing they have is good as well.

They sell old-fashioned sodas in glass bottles, which I love. 

The dining room is HUGE and this place could easily accomodate a LARGE party

The food is served cafeteria style, but the quality of the food is way beyond.

Solid bbq. Solid service. Nice storefront. The food and atmosphere are excellent and the 25 cent coffee rocks!!  In Gilbert, it will be difficult to beat this BBQ.  And the unique soda's are a plus.  I like this place a lot.

All of Joes places are good. This is a great fast food barbecue Restaruant in Gilbert. It's not my first choice, but it is surely good! This is hands down better then Rudy's BBQ. The brisket is nice and I love the spicy sauce. Pro tip....come on your birthday and receive $10 off your meal. So worth it!

The ribs are perfectly smoked and the sauce is sweet and spicy. The hot links are delicious as is the beef chopped brisket. The beans are the best and the Mac and cheese is very tasty. The homemade root beer is delightful.

the root beer is worth six stars, the food, worth four, the fact that they won't let me eat my lunch while sitting on the John Deere- one.  overall a nice four. let me sit on the tractor next time, and I'll bump it to five.

This place is hit or miss with me...more often then not I think the meat is dry.  I do like their BBQ sauce and sides: red onion relish and pickles.  Most of their side dishes are pretty good...I go for the corn and potato casserole.  Me and my fiancé usually split a 3 choice sampler.
I love everything here...  the bbq beans, corn and corn bread are awesome!!  BBQ Pork is my favorite with the spicy bbq sauce.

I take it back.... 5 stars all the way!!! 

I love this place. I love the cafeteria feel, the amazing bbq you smell a block away from the parking lot. Everything!

I even had the yummy home-made rootbeer, even though I'm not a big fan of rootbeer in general.
qThere's a John Deere tractor in the middle of the restaurant, pretty cool. Food was good and BBQ sauce was unique. Great place for the family! Big menu and a Pick-up order window outside.

We wanted to try this place based on the good reviews.  The building is really cool, as well as the surrounding area.  Inside, on a Friday night, the place was packed.   The restaurant is cafeteria style and the line went from the back to the front of the restaurant.  Plenty of seating and a huge tractor inside.  We tried the homemade rootbeer, which seemed overly sweet.  I think I'll stick with Barq's.  I tried the brisket and the chicken breast.  Brisket was descent.  Chicken was terrible.  It had an odd flavor, not to my liking.  My husband  said the sausage wasn't good.  My son said his ribs weren't that good.  The beans were amazing and filled with lots of meat, so that had to be my favorite part.  Oddly, the bread and the cheesy potatoes both had jalapenos in them, so both of the kids wouldn't eat either one.  The best part for my 5 yr. old was the chocolate chip cookie that came with his meal.  Probably won't be back with the family.  I was actually disappointed that most of the actual BBQ didn't taste that great.

Delicious!  Joe's is the best BBQ that I tried in AZ.  I loved all their selections because they have something for everyone, from ribs to giant baked potatoes.

There is really not much I can say that the other reviewers have't said though so I'll just leave it with a 2 thumbs up! 

Oh, and I love the old tractor that's inside. haha  It's a classic... a 1948 A Series tractor.  Tad, the owner told me so! :)

See ya there!

Great BBQ, although not a huge fan of the cafeteria style ordering. I have been twice, I got the brisket sandwich one time and ribs the next. Both were delicious. I added  bbq sauce to the ribs because I thought they needed it. Try the homemade root beer at least once, too. YUM. We got there just in time ( a bit before 6 on a Friday night)  as we were leaving the line was 3x as long...out the door and around the corner.  Oh FYI...for sides I got the beans (loved them) and my kids said the macaroni and cheese was good. Dad wasn't impressed with the coleslaw.

OMG, where is the 6th star for Joe's Real BBQ? :D

What can I say about Joe's? Found this place via Yelp when planning my trip to Gilbert and was expecting some good bbq as rated by fellow yelpers.  Needless to say, it did not disappoint!

I had the sampler plate: Ribs, chicken, pulled porks, brisket, + 2 sides (mac & cheese and coleslaw)  for $12.99!! and  fresh lemonade all for another $2.  The bbq sauce was delicious, and I especially liked the pulled pork (considering I'm not a big fan of pulled pork, this says a lot).  The ribs could be cooked a little longer, as I like my ribs to fall off the bones. But it was still delicious nonetheless.

For the quality and price, you can't beat this!  

+ $0.25 for coffee! 

Can it get any better?

We've been going to Joe's for years and it's always been pretty consistently good... until the past two months. We started getting the family deal on the weekend for watching football and the first couple times it was great, but ever since the ribs are really dry. We keep trying, thinking this time it'll be good again, but today was probably our last visit to Joe's. Not only were the ribs dry again, but the beans were too sweet, the corn was sickeningly buttery, and my soda cup had a hole in the bottom. Total fail. I don't know if there's been changes or they just don't care anymore, but we won't be back.

We love Joe's Real BBQ. I love the Pork sandwich, Mac N Cheese, and Chocolate Chip cookie. I get that combo every single time because it's just so good! It all comes out to under $9. Plus if you go on your birthday you get $10 worth of food for free! Awesome place, fun environment much like a cafeteria. The line may be hard if you have lots of kids but I would just take their order and have an adult go sit down with the kids and then have them come back to get their food when ready.
Usually get joes Togo this was my first time eating in and it still was amazing. I recommend the chopped brisket! Dont let the long line scare you away it goes by fairly quick.
I have been taking my daughter here since she was little. The food is awesome and the backyard play area is great...!!!  YUM! !!!

Damn. This is one of those best kept secret places only it's no secret! Just look at the lines after 5. We were lucky to cruise in just before about a hundo or so people came rushing in...almost like they came out of the bushes or something. WOW!

and for good reason I think this is the best BBQ west of the 
M-I-S-S-I-S-S-I-P-P-I in fact it was sooooo good I went back again while in town for the Waste Management Phonix Open for the week. I would wrestle you down for those ribs and hop over the counter and serve myself that damn tasty pork and sausage.

The mac and cheese was prolly the best I've had, the BBQ beans just how I like it. I honestly think you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Service is amazingly fast. The lines dissappear almost as fast as they form.

The ONLY reason why this is a 4 is because of the lack of beer! Come on man, BBQ=BEER!!!

Great BBQ, I would only recommend the sliced brisket. Mac-n-cheese is nice a creamy. I wished they served some fried pickles. Maybe also add some jalapeno poppers. But overall a great place to eat. Ohh make sure you go there on your birthday, your meal is free.

The place its self is a real neat building. Love the huge mural on the inside, the old tractor and ample space. I like the simple farm decorations. The exterior has many picnic tables for large groups with pergolas. The line to order your food, maybe because it was my first time, was hard to find. After wondering around we found it. 

The service, well its ok. Kind and straight to the point. Its a cafeteria line.

I ordered the turkey jalapeno sausage, it was dry with no real character of flavor.  The hot and spicy sauce was not hot nor spicy. The pickle bar was pretty good and I enjoyed the water melon.

Price was ok. About $13 for a one meat dish with one side and drink.

Great brisket & chicken, bbq sauce was good, just had a little taste. Friends enjoyed the cheesy potatoes & apple crisp. Would recommend it to anyone. Also the outside dining would be great for the fall or winter

Found this place on accident, and I think I just had a life changing experience. This is some of the best food I've ever had, in my life.

I had a pulled pork sandwich, Mac and cheese, cornbread with honey butter, and a few bites of my friend's sweet potato pie. Everything is absolutely heavenly.

Please, please do your self a favor and try this place out. It's worth whatever wait you may have standing in line.

When you don't want to drive all the way out to Joe's Farm Grill, Joe's Real BBQ is a good stand-in.  There is a large outdoor area where the kids can play while the adults eat.  Please don't climb the trees, kids!  They have a patio area where they host private events.  They were hosting a wedding reception while we were there.

Joe's BBQ is organized like a cafeteria style line, where you grab your tray and drinks first.  They have Boylan's soda and amazing homemade Root beer that pairs perfectly with smoky meat.  Someone dishes up your sides and they also tell the kitchen your meat order at that time.  Some of the sides are better than others.  The mac and cheese is missing moistness and cheesiness.  The cole slaw tastes great when slathered on a pulled pork sandwich, but it's awfully wet.  The beans consist of a variety of types of beans and some bits of BBQ beef.  

Don't skip dessert!  Your meal will end on a high note if you pick up a gooey chocolate cookie or blueberry cheesecake.  

All the meat is very moist and tender.  Although the meat has great flavor, their habanero sauce and classic sauce goes well on just about everything.

Anything I say here will have already been said but Joe's is the best BBQ in the east valley. 

The food is great, the place is clean, seating inside or outside, their Saturday Breakfast is awesome and I don't want to get in trouble for telling you what kind of experience your mouth will have with the home made root beer. 

Lets just say if your spouse makes you feel like this root beer make your mouth feel you are one lucky person.

Mmmmm mmmmm.  Love this BBQ.  The flavors are spot on.  Huge fan of pulled pork and brisket.  Both were great.  

Picked up and took home, so never been inside.  LOVE the outside pickup window.  

Definitely need to eat here!!

Well, I can't say I'm impressed. The chicken was dry, the ribs are standard, and the pulled pork in bland. When you go to a place that swears they are "real bbq", they should be upload that standard. Its my second time here, and not much as changed. The plus side, the staff is pleasant and not over attentive.

Since my initial review, I've tried a handful of BBQ places in a handful of states, and my opinion on Joes has changed, unfortunately. While they have decent ribs, decent brisket, decent sides, nothing really stands out compared to the competition. I'll admit, if you're in the area and craving BBQ, this restaurant is worth stopping in and eating as it is quality barbecue. However, IF you NEED the best BBQ that money can buy, keep looking. 

FYI, I'm still looking for that place in Phoenix area, so if you know of it, let me know!! :-)

Joe's barbecue is an icon in downtown Gilbert. Great place to bring the family for some good food. They have a nice outdoor sitting area with grass for the kids to play in. The waiting line to order your food is sometimes out the door which really stinks but it does go pretty quickly considering it's a buffet style set up. The only thing that ever holds you up is the indecisive patron. As a connoisseur of food, barbecue is one of those things you take to heart. Joe's ranks pretty high on my list of barbecue do's. My recommendation is the stuffed potato with your choice of meat on top. Ribs are usually pretty delectable. They also have a pretty nice root beer on tap.

This is my favorite bbq place! i highly recommend going there to eat ther ribs are so good so is there sweet corn! Oh did i forget, i love the style of there place its like a cafeteria but with great food and good service!

For a great family dining experience, Joe's is the place to go.  Awesome homemade food including my favorites, cheesy potatoes, macaroni and cheese, and apple crisp.  Did I mention homemade root beer, red cream soda, and fresh lemonade?  The moist, and tender pulled pork sandwich is to die for.   Joe's offers a delicious, clean, fun, family friendly dining experience.  Plus, if it's your birthday, you get a free meal!

I love the baked potato with pulled pork and every time I come here I drink like 3 glasses of their homemade root beer, it's amazing!! Food portions are big but that's okay because we always have enough for lunch the next day! Parking is the only thing that's not always good but it is downtown Gilbert after all.

Before I throw in my two cents, I feel like I should point out something that many of the reviewers here are overlooking: There are many different styles of barbeque, and it is not really appropriate to complain about one style because it's not like another. (To me, this is like going to a real Chicago pizzeria and complaining that the pizzas are "thick.") Some styles of BBQ involve thin, vinegary sauces; others involve meat that's swimming in a thick sauce; and still others (like Joe's) involve meat that's served "dry" with sauce added like a condiment.

In my opinion, this latter form of BBQ is the hardest to pull off. The reason is that the meat must be able to stand on its own. I think Joe's does this quite well. I usually get pulled pork or chicken. The meat is generally moist and smoky, but with a good crust (on chicken breasts, the outside edges may start to dry during smoking, but I actually enjoy that). I believe the meat is dry-rubbed before it is smoked, as it has a good spiced flavor to it. I usually place my order with "no sauce" so that I can get the spicy BBQ sauce that is available at the condiment bar.

The sides are homemade--my favorite is the baked beans, which is smoky and contains chunks of chicken and pork. The cornbread is of the variety that is not sweet, but it also is a bit too dry for my taste. 

If you go during a very busy time, you should be prepared to wait in line 15-20 minutes. But keep in mind it is cafeteria style, so you get your food right when you order. Sit-down restaurants would likely take 15-20 minutes to bring your food to the table anyway. Also, if it's crowded (and too hot to sit outside), it might be difficult to get a table, and the busboys might not be able to clear the tables as fast as people are leaving them, so scout out a table early. (That being said, if it is not crowded, Joe's is as fast as any fast food restaurant--you could be sitting down and eating within two minutes.)

Went mid afternoon order a pulled pork sandwich, rack of ribs... wouldn't consider this place authentic by any means... I've had better frozen meals in my time. Also so called "handmade" root beer wasn't as good as I expected. Pulled pork sandwich bun was stale, and actual meat on sandwich was dry. Not worth the 20 or so bucks I wasted.

Great food, have tried it several times Ann's haven't been disappointed.  
Don't forget to order their homemade root beer

We had a catered lunch from them. Chicken was great, bbq sauce was fantastic, pork was too sweet, beans were average, macaroni was average. I would eat here for the chicken and bbq sauce. That being said, I am a picky ass when it comes to bbq sauce and I enjoyed this places bbq sauce lol.

Great food and service! Pulled pork and hot link jumbo sandwich are my favorite. Ribs are my fiance's favorite. Always get the homemade rootbeer. Never had a problem with anything about Joes BBQ

Huge supporters of US Military in uniform.

Clean restraunt, friendly staff, and fair pricing on food.

Love how the owner goes around the restraunt, greets people and even assists on cleaning tables. Great leadership!

I was in Gilbert for a soccer tournament and decided to try this place since it had over 900 reviews. I was excited to try a new BBQ place with so many positives. The building itself is a pretty cool looking establishment. I went around the side to order takeout at the curb. (They a have a takeout window so you can order from the sidewalk) I ordered the 2 meat plate ($12.99) with 2X brisket and added pulled pork for $4.99. Total was $19 and change. I was really hungry. I was PRAYING it was going to be good in order to justify this ridiculously high price point.

The meat: The brisket was very dry and flavorless. It had a very mild smoke flavor, unfortunately I had to drown it in the sauce to reconstitute it. The pulled pork was ok. It had a hint of smoke and it was at least moist, probably the best part of the meal. But that isn't saying much, I've turned out better pulled pork with a crock pot, liquid smoke and some Sweet Baby Rays. 

The sides: The "cheesy potatoes," just a Luke warm congealed scoop of boiled, undercooked and overcooked, slightly mashed potatoes with no sign of  cheese anywhere. They were not salted or seasoned, and very bland. Had a few bites and didn't see the need to finish them. The "Coleslaw." Basically, the slaw was 8oz of RTE bagged shredded "slaw mix" put in to a styrofoam container with no appreciable slaw sauce or seasonings. It had a very sour flavor, like vinegar and old cabbage. I tried a forkful, and it tasted like smelled, and that was it for me.

Very disappointed, I was looking forward to something there after a long day in the sun, but all it was, was just another overdone, overhyped and overpriced wannabe big city restaurant. Spend less on the rent and more on the quality of product. No sense in having a beautiful restaurant that serves very subpar food. Sorry to say, I will not return.

I like it.
Did a couple racks of thier bones for thanksgiving one year.  Who needs turkey? My brother and family lives in Gilbert, I try to visit them often.  Please don't tell him it's for the Q!

Yum yum!!! The meat is tender, falls apart.  Get some extra BBQ sauce.  The corn bread and honey butter make a perfect pair.  The kids loved the Mac & cheese.  The atmosphere is open, cool and comfortable.  Great for the family. Service is EXCELLENT!!! So friendly and kind.  You have to eat here when you're in the area. They also sell the BBQ sauce ($4.30 each) to take home and share with others.

Always a treat to eat here. The cafeteria line is annoying in some aspects but it always ends up worthwhile. Love the ribs and root beer products. My wife loves the brisket and she's not much a meat eater.  When people come from out of town they always request to come here

Joe's BBQ is theee BOMB! Me and my boyfriend has made this place our 1 and only go to BBQ place. I always order the jumbo stuffed baked potato and I add meat on top with extra hot & spicy BBQ sauce..yumm 

For sides I always get the potato salad and a side salad I really like their bbq ranch dressing...with a cup of lemonade 

I've tried the sampler(my bf always orders that), it's pretty good, but I'll stick with the baked potato lol fyi he loves the cheesy potato and I have to I really like them too

The staff is really nice and always smiling, it's always pretty crowded when I go there so that says alot! (Friendly crowd)

Not pricey at all!

If you aren't concerned about eating healthy, and you want some tasty BBQ, this is definitely the place to go. However, do not expect anything on the menu to be Organic or GMO-free, or necessarily from animal-friendly farms. 

This was the response from Joe's Real BBQ to my email after asking if any of the items were Organic or GMO-free: 

"Thanks for the inquiry.  After checking with our chef this morning, our chicken breast is natural, but other than that, we really don't have any specific items that would fit the definition of Organic or GMO free.

The Management Team BK
Joe's Real BBQ"

On a side note: Any food labeled or proclaiming to be 'Natural' means nothing. Many people consider chemicals to be natural. That being said, this is not a healthy place to eat, if you care about your health. 

I'm not saying the food isn't good because it tastes great (I broke all of my rules and tried it) but I won't be going back simply because of my personal preferences.

I really was not impressed. The mac and cheese is bland, the coleslaw is watery, the watermelon was not ripe all the way, the jalepeno bread is a strange mix of flavore, and the ribs were fatty. The BBQ sauce is wonderful! The drinks are great, like they have cream soda and such, and the cornbread was dry but tasty. There are no booster seats around and the table is too high for my 2 year old, and it was $44 for my mom and I. I don't understand why this place has such good reviews. I prefer ribs from outback over this.
We love Joes.  The good is always good and they feed you for free on your birthday!  Its a regular go-to for our family.

Very disappointed.. The prices keep going up but it's still the same menu.  It's expensive to eat here for what u get. I ordered a jumbo sandwich with turkey and sliced brisket, coleslaw and Mac n cheese. The meats were dry and one whole slice of brisket was all fat. The Mac n cheese was dry. The slaw was good. My husband returned his fatty brisket and switched to ribs - which where overcooked - his cheesy potatoes had hair in it
This use to be a good value and good food. But after 15years - it's now boring - same old menu- and the staff is just mediocre.  I can make bbq for less than the $55 dollars we spent on 3 people.

What can I say, it was as good as everyone says it is!

I went on Sunday, trekked across the desert sands to beautiful old town Gilbert (never been!) And walked intothe most stinkin cute joint I've been to in awhile! Anyplace that has 25cent coffee and CANDY BUTTONS is going to earn high marks from me.

So why no 5 stars? Its minor stuff, and Joes is more of a 4 1/2 star place in my book. I ordered the chopped brisket sandwhich, after asking the girl in the paper hat if she preferred that or the pulled pork. It was amazing, though I was surprised to find I needed extra bbq sauce, since its cooked in the stuff. No matter, the sauce is free and delicious. Also ordered bbq beans- amazing- and mac & cheese -lost me a bit here. I wanted to love it, but felt it could use something extra and not just be standard mac & cheese. The crumbs were nice, but overall, this was just ok for me. Got a homemade rootbeer to wash it down- great touch. Next time, I'm going for the red cream! To finish (dear God, this was a lot of food lol) I had the apple crisp. Frowny face. Seriously, I 
was disappointed. For one, I much prefer red apples in a crisp, green tart apples seem wrong to me. Also, my crisp was missing its namesake and was more like slightly chewy. 

Total: $14.11... but did I mention the BOGO coupon for a weekend breakfast they threw in? I'm a sucker for savings!

One of our favorites~ take out or eat in I love this place. The one and only place I've been to that compares is actually in southern Georgia! This is real bbq at it's best. The seating is kind of cafeteria style. The place is always busy and the food is always fresh!
Food was great. The meat was well cooked and the sides were amazing. I'd suggest the beans and mac&cheese.
OVER priced BBQ... This place has horribly long lines due to their slow service. Mediocre at best.

We decided to try based on the good reviews. This place is way overrated, they must be writing their own reviews. I def won't be coming back. We came with a group of 5 (3 kids) and spent $75 for virtually nothing. The sides were all horrible. The chicken breast was descent, but not for the money. If you want real BBQ go to Lucille's or Charleston's or better yet Texas Roadhouse. I don't know how this place stays in business. What a rip off. Customer service was horrible!

I've eaten BBQ all over the US. This is hands down the best!  Everything on their menu is delicious and their customer service is spectacular!  I've also served their food at several events. You can't go wrong here.

Delicious food (that brisket doe..), cafeteria type set-up. Always a line when I come so you know it's good but the line moves very fast. Plenty of seating inside and out. I will make the trek to Gilbert for this stuff, wish there was one more central besides in the airport.

I was expecting really good bbq with how busy it was there. My husband and I ordered take out. The brisket was decent and the spicy bbq sauce was good, but the sides were lacking. The corn tasted like it was straight from a can without any taste and the Mac n cheese was extremely bland and dry. I couldn't force myself to eat more than a few bites, it just wasn't  worth the calories for me. The coke tasted odd. I probably would not visit again.

So many rave reviews. I like this place. It's pretty good and it's always consistent. Consistency is very difficult to manage for a barbecue restaurant in my opinion. Although I don't believe it is the best barbecue joint in town, it is the best I've had on the East side.

I always get the brisket and chicken. The turkey sausages aren't spicy enough for me, but their sides are pretty good. I like the .25 coffee, and you eat free on your birthday.

We accidentally made it to Joe's Real BBQ in Gilbert this weekend, while searching for something totally different for dinner.  Running out of time, we stopped at Joe's in Gilbert.  I like the atmosphere, big tables, lots of outdoor (covered) seating, indoor, as well, with a rustic look n feel.  I had the pulled pork and beef brisket, with sides of cheesy potatoes and corn.  The corn was good (mmm, buttery!) but the cheesy potatoes were mostly inedible.  I was told later that the beans were the way to go, though.  However, the meats was absolutely delicious!  The smoke ring on the brisket was perfect, the pork moist and tender!  I was in heaven!  I tried the hot BBQ sauce, and was not disappointed!  It was fiery!  Great place for families, very kid friendly.

If I have to go to Gilbert for lunch or dinner, I'll definitely go here, again.

There is a tractor sitting in the dining room and the whole place smell like mesquite BBQ

 Joe's is all about the rural town that Gilbert AZ was, not long ago.

 It's very casual, fun, kid-friendly cafeteria style dining.

  The ribs were REALLY good, and the side were awesome too. Homemade apple sauce, huge baked potatoes, fresh coleslaw, homemade lemonade,. yum!!!

The patio is spacious with lots of room to relax. Very cute place and you won't leave hungry!






.

A fun place with yummy food in downtown Gilbert. This is a great family place. I would recommend it for any out of town guests you may have visiting you. It works for adults and for kids. There is outdoor seating. Oh yeah you want to know about the food. I usually get the pulled pork or salad. Yup salad, it's great with turkey! My husband always gets the brisket and loves it. You will see a lot of people with the loaded baked potato. For a good reason , it is delicious. Again I get the turkey on it. When I do get the potato, I also get a to go box. It is really big!

I'm a massive BBQ snob.   I admit it.   I own several smokers, been doing it a long time and I know what good BBQ is.    Doing it en-masse, is a whole other ball game.   These guys make great food.

Easy 5 stars.   The ribs, the brisket, the sides --- all excellent!   I haven't had this good of restaurant BBQ for a long time.   I'm not sure if I just caught them on a good day or not, but I'll definitely be back to find out.    Come see for yourself.    

I love the  funky 40's motif too.

A good barbecue spot. The food is usually not fresh as it is served cafeteria style.  However, the food is good here and if you get it catered, it is actually fresh, so I would definitely recommend their catering service.
We went here after a friend raved about it! To me it was ok, but nothing out of the ordinary. Very boring menu and atmosphere. C+

The best bbq we've had in a long time. Great location.  Friendly staff. Lots of tables and space for larger groups. The food is fantastic. Ribs and brisket melt in your mouth.  Homeade root beer yumm. Not too impressed with the cheddar potatoes but the beans were delicious.  Highly recommend this place.

Great place to go for BBQ if you have lots of kids.  The food is good and they have an open grassy area (the grass is still trying to come on this last visit).  We had a good time and it was an easy place for multiple families to enjoy and informal meal.

I was very fond of my visit to Joe's Real BBQ. I had been to Joe's farm so I was eager to check this place out. I am not big on pork ribs but this food was delicious! Service was quick and with a friendly smile-always appreciated-but not always offered at other restaurant. 


Prices were competitive and atmosphere was enjoyable!

We ate here with some friends a couple of weeks ago.  The food was ok.  I think what we enjoyed most is the outside seating.  It is set up like someone's back yard with middle school lunch tables on the grass and white picket fences.  We went in the evening and they have old fashioned Christmas lights hanging from trees that give it a nice ambiance.  In the summer I can see how it would be nice to sit outside.  They have homemade root beer which I thought was novel.  The menu is very basic as is with most BBQ places and the BBQ sauce was just ok.  I'd go back because it seems fun for a date.

Food is always amazing - never disappointed. If you want a refill on your drink it's embarrassing to go in front of people in line, but maybe they designed it that to discourage refills? I didn't see a sign for No Refills.... 

Great food and good service! The patio is refreshing to eat on. The bathrooms smell like their smokers for meat, my husband now wants our bathroom to smell like that... 

Thanks for a great meal and experience!

Tried this place 3 times now wanting to like it but it's just not that good.  The meat is ok but the sides are terrible.  The locals love this place but I doubt any of them have had any of the big three: KC, Memphis, or S. Carolina BBQ, Joe's is not real BBQ.  We will NOT be back.

There were so many mixed reviews that we decided to try it out for ourselves. If you go on a Friday night plan on getting there before 5 (ha) otherwise you'll be waiting a while. We got there at 6 and finally got to the front at 6:45. We were in good company so we didn't mind waiting but other people in line were very irritated. I got the loaded baked potato with BBQ pork on top and it was delicious. If you're from the south it doesn't compare, we get it, but for Gilbert it's a pretty good BBQ spot.

Just moved to Gilbert this week from Southern California.  One of our 1st eating adventures was trying out Joe's Real BBQ.  Tonight was our 1st of many more trips to come.  Good customer service, Great food and very affordable!

Being a Gilbert native, there is just not very many spots to go to get quality barbecue. Joe's Real BBQ is situated in the rapidly expanding part of downtown ripe with new and trendy restaurant options, but that has not always been the case. Just a few years ago, it stood as the "king of the hill" of a rather lackluster downtown area. Nowadays, the unassuming brick building of BBQ has amassed many food neighbors including Zinburger, Joyride, and Postino, yet Joe's still is the crowd favorite. I was there a couple days ago ordering food to go and the line to dine in completely wrapped around the corner! On a weekday!

There aren't too many options on the menu, which makes it very simple for newcomers of the joint. I got the BBQ sampler which contains 3/4 lbs of pure meaty goodness including ribs, chicken, pulled pork, and brisket. The ribs were sweet and well seasoned, the brisket was flavorful, but a little too tough for my taste, the pulled pork was deliciously standard, and the chicken was moist, tender, and all around the best part of the plate. I really enjoy that they do not heavily lean on barbecue sauce to make the entree taste great. 

One minor problem I have is that it can get pricey for the amount of food received. I could definitely eat more than their biggest option on the menu. 

Overall, it is a fantastic, no frills, family-oriented spot that does the job in a place scarce of real barbecue.

Honestly...I'm almost 50 yrs old..and this is by far one of the Best BBQ meals that Ive ever eaten!! I can now proclaim: I'VE FOUND MY GO-TO BBQ PLACE! Downtown Gilbert is such a peaceful, comfortable little town that makes you feel you're in a much snazzier area. This place was packed with a line out the door but it moved along at a good pace. I was expecting my sampler platter to be twice it's price. My Fiance' and I both had meals, drinks and desert for around $41.00.....The cookies were warm, the cheesecake made me pee myself a little I was so excited to eat it! The inside was roomy, there is covered and uncovered dining outside with a coffee house next door feat live music! 2 drawbacks....1) the drinks are smack dab in the middle of the long line...ppl wanting to get to the food (oh! its a cafeteria style meal dining) are constantly being stepped in front of by thirst mongers...ANNOYING..and a tight squeeze. 2) The long lines snake past some prime real estate for sitting...but who wants to see a thousand assess and sneezing kids constantly going by and rubbing against you knocking your bobby pins loose from your couiffe...couife...shit...hair do! Eat here!

i love this place!

i always order the bbq sampler plate for $12.  i believe 2 ribs, chicken, pork, beef and a side dish come with the order.  it's great when compared to most bbq restaurants.  i like the meat and seasoning.  no complaints.

the parking and lines are usually a joke.  it seems like whenever i go to joe's there is a line to order.

give it a shot.  if you like it great.  if you don't then you can go to hell.  jk.

The food here is pretty good. Some of the sides aren't always hot, but overall it's a good option for some tasty bbq. The place is very clean and the staff efficient. We typically go here on our birthdays for a free birthday meal which is a nice offering.

My FAVORITE BBQ place in the state of Arizona!!! I order the pulled pork sandwich every single time with a side of homemade cheesy Mac and cheese with cheez-it crumbs sprinkled on top....it's to die for!!! OMG and for desert, their chocolate chip cookies are so warm and soft, it melts in your mouth....agh so good!!! The service is awesome too, everyone is very attentive and friendly! The food is served like a school cafeteria style, it's fun! I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for GOOD food!! Just be sure to get there a little bit earlier than "dinner time" or "lunchtime" cause it gets busy!!! The line will be all the way out the door sometimes!

This is so good! We went to the coffee shop next to it, and my husband smell the BBQ, he said he wanted some for dinner. Ok. We went to the window ordered two meat plate and a side, plus a corn bread. I love the brisket. I bet the ribs are good too. Gonna go back.

Simply amazing! I can be a bit picky about meat, but I ended up loving this place! I had the meat platter, ordered beef brisket, beans, cheesy potatoes and a wonderfully gooey, and warm chocolate chip, which were all scrumptious. I also thought the cafeteria style method of getting your food was cute.
Best BBQ I've had in Arizona. I spent time in Texas and got spoiled. This is the closest thing to Texas BBQ! So so good and reasonably priced. They even have a pick up window outside!
Great place to grab some quick BBQ. I accidentally ordered a different plate than normal and they upgraded me free of charge. Very friendly staff and a nice environment.
Oh my gosh so good and enough to feed an army I'm visiting from California and this place was super impressive

Great lunch treat! The grands had chicken and ham sandwich's and Ashley and I each had baked potatoes with the works and chopped brisket!  I may not eat a dinner tonight.  That was a lot of food for a lunch!  The brisket was very well done and the sauce is superb.  $$$

I don't know why it's taken me so long to write a review for Joes! We've been coming here for years and have a great experience every time! We can always count on the food tasting the same and the staff being friendly. We like the brisket and pulled pork! The mac and cheese is yummy and the homemade root beer is our favorite. Family friendly with plenty of seating for large groups!

This is an all time favorite for my daughter and I. Always a great meal. The pulled pork is to die for and I crave their apple crisp from time to time. Great family friendly environment in cute downtown Gilbert. Winning recipe!

Overall okay experience.  I hate to say that I've had better bbq and I rate this restaurant as mediocre because it is not all that it's hyped up to be.  Then again, most of the undeserved stellar reviews, is probably due to those who don't have much to compare to in great bbq.
When I got there, I was first impressed with the smokers out back, and had high expectations.  Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed with the quality of the flavor of meat.  I tried the sampler, which indeed is a pretty good value, however, good smoked meat shouldn't be drenched in bbq sauce.  It's almost as though the soul purpose of the sauce was to keep the meat moist to mask the actual dryness of the pulled pork and ribs.    The beans were very good, and the potatoe salad was okay.

To be honest, I highly doubt I'll ever return.

I'm not quite sure where all the rave reviews come from for Joe's BBQ... I've been two times with different people and no one would come back. The meat is ok... Sides horrendous. Arizona clearly doesn't know what good barbecue is, because if you compare this crap to Kansas City barbecue, it's pathetic. 

If cafeteria style, bland ass, if-I-had-to-imagine-what-prison-food-tasted-like-food seems appealing to you, try this joint.

I have to preface this with saying that I have a pretty extreme bias against Gilbert. Almost everything about this place and what it stands for annoys me. And, just so you know, Gilbert, everyone else in the Valley hates you. Yeah, even AJ.
This little homogenized, car-centric Mayberry-ish strip crammed onto Gilbert Road is often where I lead tourists if they're, for whatever reason, not interested in leaving the Southeast Valley and have no interest in Downtown Chandler (which I think is a great area). But it may be easy to miss this strip, because there will be at least four of Gilbert's finest waiting for you to tick up to 26, and that, in itself, may distract you.
But I had never actually stopped here. Finding the well-rated, independently-owned Joe's, open on a Sunday, was a good excuse to take the back way up from Tucson on my way to an airport pick-up and grab a brisket sandwich.
The brisket sandwich itself comes at just $6.99 and includes one small (not a size, but a descriptor) side item. They also have homemade cornbread and a few homemade desserts on the menu. Impressive. It's cafeteria style, so you wait with your little tray, while people in front of you act like they've never worked a soda fountain before, and order at the counter. That's a good little scam, because people are much less likely to get a refill if there's a crowd blocking them. And, at $1.99, I would expect a couple of free refills.
And that sort of set the tone for everything in that, aside from my sandwich, the other menu items seemed overpriced. The piece of cornbread that I ended up trying (I can't pass up homemade versions) ran me $2 and the deserts were like $3 for some pretty small servings.
I also should point out something I saw in another review, which mentioned the "homemade" root beer and red cream soda: the root beer is homemade (probably outsourced locally, but close enough), but the red cream soda is Barq's.
The sandwich was relatively small. Maybe three slices of brisket present on a hamburger bun, with just a little bit of sauce. And that was a good thing, because the sauce was far exceeded by the brisket, which itself was a little dry and oversmoked. The sauce tasted like a bottle of Kraft's BBQ sauce with ketchup added. Very little spice, way too tomatoey. At least, for my standards, but I know that everyone has their own opinions.
The cornbread was a mistake. Dry, flavorless, and it probably would have made my mema turn in her grave. It was hot and served with a slop of butter stuffed into a SOLO cup, but I didn't end up opening it. Maybe I'm crazy, but I always eat the first piece of cornbread with no butter, just to get an idea of the flavor.
The side was probably the best thing that I got out of the deal. The cheesy potatoes were a little overcooked (or had been sitting for too long), but they were a nice blend of cheese, cream and green chile (nice touch).
Atmosphere reminded me a bit of some of the places I used to go to in Texas, with the high ceilings, big tables and outdoor patio (another nice touch). And, maybe because of that, something just seemed too deliberate about this place.
If you like this place, feel free to continue coming here. But I'm going to keep searching for a decent BBQ place in this state.

I've come here a couple of times now as I have family close by. 
This place is pretty fantastic. 
The portions are huge, the meat is juicy and tender, the sauces are well balanced and the staff is friendly as can be. 

It gets a 4 from me, because this is probably the best bbq there is to be had in Arizona.

AMAZING! Went on a Saturday night and the line went all the way back to the front door, but it went by very quickly. Kind of a cafeteria-style set up. You grab a tray and your drink, then go through and order your food and get it immediately. Very efficient and you get to see how fresh everything is.
Prices are great--much better than other bbq places I've gone to.
I got the pulled pork sandwich with sweet corn and mac and cheese. Everything was flavorful and portions were fair. The spicy sauce wasn't that spicy at all, though.
Joe really cares about delivering great BBQ and a unique experience.  He succeeds at both.  Our favorite sides are the cheesy potatoes and the beans.  The pecan wood smoked meats are so good!

You walk into Joe's Real BBQ, get into line and grab a tray. The menu is gigantic upon the wall and you can pick your main dish selection. On my last trip, I had the pulled pork sandwich. Then, as you slide your tray on the counter, you pick your sides (you get two with each "meal" selection). I had their mac n' cheese... nom... and the corn... also delicious. And, of course you pay for your meal - I don't remember what my bill came out to, but I know it wasn't outrageous. 

Then, you have your food and you can go sit down at a table. They have a large eating space with tables and booths and even outdoor seating. The atmosphere is very casual and a great place to eat some BBQ. 

If you're not in the mood to sit and dine at the restaurant, they have an outdoor window located on the South side of the building where you can place your order, wait a few minutes and get your food to go.
If you want pulled pork bbq, this is the place! Fabulous! You must try the homemade root beer!

I fell in love with this place after trying it for the first time. It's a cafeteria-style BBQ place. Everything there is good. You can't go wrong. Beans. Root beer chocolate cake. Meats. Bread. All soooo good

My wife and I tried the new breakfast menu this morning.  We both really enjoyed it, especially the Mother Lode Burrito with milk gravy and the Raspberry Bread Pudding.  I have to say they really know how to make milk gravy; most restaurants and even home cooks have no clue as to what good milk gravy is, so I was impressed.

One thing they are going to struggle with a bit is that scrambled eggs will never be excellent when they're served cafeteria style.  The same goes for potatoes.  That's the primary reason our breakfast was very good, but not exceptional.  I understand this isn't something they can really change, but thought it was worth sharing the observation as eggs are key to most breakfast dishes.   

Overall, the new breakfast is very tasty and well concieved.  We'll be back again in the near future I'm sure!

BTW, the 25 cent coffee is a nice throwback.  If you want a refill you just drop a quarter in the pink piggy bank on the honor system--pretty cool.

Good food, very expensive for what you get. They charge way too much for their sides. Been there a bunch of times the ribs are usually pretty good but once in a while they're not that great it's hit or miss but usually hit. I feel there could be a better barbecue place out there that I just haven't been to but as of now this is my favorite in Arizona.

Walking into this place reminded me of a couple BBQ joints I have visited in St Louis and KC. Unfortunately, the food didn't quite match the fun, laid back atmosphere.  Though a bit dry, I enjoyed the mild smoked flavor of the brisket...the bark was quite tasty.  The ribs also had a mild smoke flavor, but were not my favorite.  They required a bit of sauce to help fend off the dryness of one bone, while a couple others were too fatty to thoroughly enjoy.  

The portions were definitely plentiful and priced just what I would expect.  I didn't leave overly comfortable around the waist line.  :-)

Hopefully, it was just an off night as I have heard several people really enjoy this place.  We will likely be back to give it another shot once it is cooler out and we can hangout in the cool picnic area they have setup.

Go big or go home right!? I haven't had too much BBQ in Arizona but what I've had I haven't been too impressed. I will however say that JOE'S REAL BBQ was really good. I'm a fan of supporting local business, and there's a nice 'comfy/family' feel to the place. Now, I come from a big bbq'ing Texas family, and though I have to express this isn't no comparison it's pretty damn good Arizona BBQ. I had to try a little of everything so I got the BBQ Sampler plate 

Over 3/4 lb. of ribs, chicken, pork and beef, bread.  Includes homemade side dish. Add a 2nd side for just $1.00 [with a side of Mac N Cheese and Beans.] Yea I couldn't finish it all, especially with having a taste of my boyfriend corn bread and my friends rootbeer cake.. Can we say HEAVEN. 

For lack of better words I was in a food coma, but walked away happy and full.

I had read about this restaurant on Roadfood.com.  I told my brother about it and he loved it.  When I was down in Phoenix last week, this was the first stop from the airport.  We got there about 6:00 and the line wasn't too long.  (It was still inside the restaurant).  
As you wait in line, you get a chance to study the menu.  There really aren't that many items to choose from.  More surprising, when you get to the counter, there are the sides you had been reading about.  They don't really match the description on the menu.  
I ordered the sampler plate and knew I had made a mistake right away.  Way too much food for me.  Included ribs, brisket, chicken, and pulled pork.  I liked the pulled pork.  Choices of mild and spicy BBQ sauce are available on the side.  We had the mashed potatoes, sweet corn, mixed beans (my favorite) and cole slaw for our sides.  Although my order came with bread, we opted for a side of corn bread.  A real nice extra, the bread was slightly sweet with a nice consistency.  Worth the extra money.  
We ate outside on picnic benches.  Large lot with a few trees that the kids loved to climb.  Very nice family atmosphere.  Worth a trip.

Great BBQ restaurant!  They have choices of meats grilled and cooked to perfection (brisket, chicken, pork, ribs) accompanied by delicious sides such as mac & cheese (not the store bought flavor, but real mac & cheese), potato salad, corn, etc.  Everything tastes delicious.  Don't miss the homemade root beer and lemonade, and the dessert line (I highly recommend the root beer cake).  The prices are also very affordable.  I love this place! :)

Overall the food is great and I don't have any complaints there. The layout and set up of the restaurant is confusing and feels chaotic during peak times for sure. Mainly because you get beverages first and you're trying to cram everything on a tray and it's all cafeteria style. The management seem really nice but the employees need to try harder to come across more friendly. I felt like trying to approach them for anything or ask questions was nerve wracking because they all seem so grumpy. Also if you need a refill or napkins you have to some how maneuver the crowded line and drink area. Other than that food and choices are great!

Delicious, consistent, good service, it's  our go-to BBQ spot in the east valley.   We also buy bulk sauce to use at home when we smoke our own meat.  The outdoor area is great for families  with small children. Excellent all around.

My brother said they had the best BBQ so I had to try it.  The line was very long but I like that they had a take out window.  The ribs where very moist and flavorful.  The corn bread with whip butter was great.  I wish they had colored greens.

I ordered the BBQ sampler.  Chicken, pork, beef, and ribs!  yum!  

Then I washed it down with their red cream soda and root beer.  yum!

Me = SATISFIED!
Always a good experience coming here. Been an occasional customer for years and have never had a bad experience. Good price, good food, good atmosphere/vibe. Earns 4 stars.

I love &  adore this place ! we have been here twice now , both times for lunch. The. BBQ is amazing ! The mac and cheese tastes like grandma used to make , the corn bread and butter are so sweet and flavorful you would swear you are eating cake. We tried the chicken breast sandwich, the pulled pork, and the brisket. My mom had the stuffed baked potato. I swear to you the potato was the size of the plate . We need to keep coming back until we have tasted everything on the menu .

I can always count on joes BBQ to be consistent in taste, temperature, and price. I am never disappointed and I love that their staff all seems so happy to be at work. The cashier has been the same one since I first discovered this place about 8 years ago, which says a lot. I eat here and I use them to cater parties at my house a few times a year. Perfect for large groups with a varying demographic of picky eaters, kids, and even the hard to please complainers. Everyone always loves Joe's!
Great BBQ. I am here for my birthday ribs. And I did not have to cook them myself. Every one should try joes

Best in town. I don't eat meat but can say anyone who does with me loves it. The mac and cheese is to die for and the potatoes. We come here for birthdays mothers day fathers day a random tuesday. It's good anytime. We love this place I've been eatin here since I was in high school when it just opened. The cookies and the cheesecake oh my god! I can't even say. I don't treat myself often I watch what I eat but when it's my son's 13th bday I enjoy! We love this place and anyone I've taken or recommended has loved it also!

What are the rules in barbecue joints that state you are required to confuse the f*ck out of paying customers every chance you get? Besides the fact that you seat yourself (sometimes), the menu (on the wall) has a long line that snakes up to it not for ordering off the wall but for picking and choosing your food like you're in a junior high cafeteria. And how dry is my meat required to be, really? There is a condiment bar but I didn't see too many condiments on it, and this is along the entrance line (full of people who are in your way). The whole thing is just awkward lugging your unevenly-weighted tray around the restaurant full of screaming mormon children.

Worst restaurant set up I've ever seen. Customers line up blocking soda refills and seated diners hovering over me as I'm trying to enjoy my dinner bumping our table. Very difficult to move around restaurant due to tables and chairs to close together. BBQ ok, but I've had better. If you must go, get it to "Go "

Meh. I like Liberty Market and the Grill...all by the same guy...but I don't get the hysteria about this place. The sauces are not ah-mazing. The meats all kind of blend together and are underwhelming. If I am in downtown Gilbert I would rather go to Liberty Markey, Postinos, or Romeo's Cafe. If I need BBQ that bad, I could go to Chilli's and get the dry-rub ribs.
I've been eating here since the 1990's and still can't find any better BBQ.  Need I say more?

Best BBQ I can find in the valley.  
Kid friendly, with plenty of space for them to run-around and play outside.
Took the wifey for lunch. Place got busy right away.  Food is good and line moved fast.

The ribs were A-ok.  The beef Brisket was DELISH.
If I ever come back I will ONLY order their ribs since that was the only thing on the menu that was really stellar.

The sides were ALL pathetic.
I had the loaded baked potato and it was old/cold= not fresh at all. Very disappointing for the $4.50 price tag.  
The pulled pork was GROSS and dry.

I smelled Joe's when i was in Gilbert, so i decided to give it a try and I was very dissatisfied, the customer service was on point very friendly but the food was egregious, cafeteria style BBQ has never really won my heart anywhere, Even in the south you only make that mistake once. The only main problem i have with bulk rapid paced meats and sides is the lack of attention to detail that would otherwise be noticed by individual servings. IE serving me raw pork in my sandwich or the Mac and Cheese being cold enough to envy a refrigerator. All in all I'll skip the line next time and try one of the other options there.

Joes is my favorite BBQ in the valley. I have catered my sons bday party from JRB the last 2 years and all my guests have raved about how good the food is. Feel lucky to have a such a great place close by to home!

Boom goes the dynamite!!!  Just tried this place for the first time.  Had the sliced brisket and the chicken with Mac and cheese and baked beans.  It was ALL GOOD.  The bark on the brisket was a 1/4" thick and just screamed legit, the chicken was tender and smokey and the stuff that good old boys dreams are made of.  Being a fat guy who has spent some time in the south I consider myself a bit of a connoisseur when it comes to finer points of good BBQ and this place meets all the requirements.  The Mac and cheese was badass, and the baked beans would make anybody's southern grandma jealous.  They also had two different house made BBQ sauces which were both awesome and apparently make their own root beer which was pretty good (not a huge root beer fan but it was good) 

I'll be back to this place for sure!  While I was waiting I mentioned to some other people that I had never been there before and they all started blurting out things to try, in case your new to eating that's a good sign LOL.  If your on the fence about trying this place get off it and start eating already!

I personally thought this was the best place In the area in 2014. I just went today and I got a jumbo pork sandwich. It didn't seem very fresh and the meat had tendons and veins, skin and other stuff most people wouldn't eat even if you paid them too. 
This place used to be super good but seems like quality is running out the door.

I absolutely loved the decor and atmosphere at Joe's.  When you walk through those doors, you're transported to a whole new place and perhaps even a whole new time.  Great place to visit and take out of town guests.

Now, I wish that I could say that the food was just as good.  Joe's is one of those places where you have to know what to order if you want to enjoy your meal as much as you enjoy the atmosphere.  Definitely go with the brisket or the sliced chicken.  Both were pretty good.  The ribs were just ok...I wouldn't other them again.  And the pulled pork was horrible.  As for sides, go with the mac and cheese (delicious) and the beans (not bad). Stay away from the coleslaw.  Oh, and give their root beer a try.  It was pretty good as well.

So, overall, the experience was pretty good and I'd go back now that I know what to order and what to stay away from.

Joes is always a great place to grab a bite. Love the spicy bbq I always get the sample plate. Love the brisket and chicken yum! Hands down some of the best root beer I've ever had. I would love to buy a gallon of it. 

 Service is always great. Friendly and quick.

Living in Gilbert, places like Joe's Real BBQ are few and far between.  Somehow, that seems to make them all the sweeter and really makes me appreciate it for what it is...a family owned, one of a kind, original BBQ joint in the middle of a suburban (semi) wasteland.  

The BBQ, although not the best I have ever had, is great.  The pulled pork is really tasty and the hot BBQ sauce is awesome.  You also can't miss the crusted mac and cheese or the homemade root beer.

If you find yourself in downtown Gilbert, don't hesitate to stop in at Joe's.  You wont be disappointed.  Grab a 'Meat Plate', sit outside under the trees at a picnic table and be thankful that you can enjoy an American staple in such a cool, little place.

Love this place!  Some of the best BBQ in the valley!  The sides are phenomenal as well and different from most traditional BBQ places that only have beans and potato salad.  Will definitely be enjoying this place in the future!

The food is quick and quality and the prices are fair.  There's better BBQ in the valley, IMO, and the setup here always bothers me.  You move through the cafeteria line and if you forget anything, like a glass of water, you're back in the potentially long line again.  Regarding the meats, I wish the brisket was more moist.  I think they use all of the fatty brisket for the chopped brisket selection.  The pork is very good and I especially like the sausages.  The side dish selection is excellent.  Good for Gilbert but I wouldn't go out of my way like I do for the Farm Grill.

I was honestly having a hard time deciding if i should give them 4 or 5 stars. I am going to swing the 5 stars because leftovers were equally as good the day after.

This place is cafeteria style restaurant. Which is good, you see your food being prepared before your very eyes. The ribs were DELICIOUS!! the meat fell off the bone cleanly. I am salivating a little bit thinking about them again. They do a real good job cooking the ribs. They don't over smother the ribs with sauce which is nice. You can add more on your own. A great smoky flavor in each bite.  Mac N cheese side was good. I wish that the crunchies on top were more crunchy, but thats my own personal preference. 

My wife had the salad, with chicken ontop. That was pretty good too. IF we didn't get meat on the salad it would have been a sad day. 

I'd love to come back sometime, its just a little far from me. :(

They have some seriously great BBQ.  Have eaten at the restaurant and ordered their catering for parties which is always a help.  The outdoor eating area is a neat place and like how family friendly it is.

Decided to try out Joe's Real BBQ - as a celebration for passing my final dental boards - the last step before being Dr. D!

I was not disappointed! I had two meats and 1 side....I live for Mac and Cheese and boy oh boy was it tasty! For the meats I had brisket (sliced) and hot link. The hot link has such good snap (you know what i mean) and the brisket was just the right amount of smokey taste

My husband had the BBQ brisket sandwich with a side of baked beans and side of cheesy potatoes. The baked beans were really really good! I feel like the only thing that was mediocre was the cheesy potatoes

We tried the Root Beer float cake - decent

We just moved to Gilbert and will definitely be back - and considering having them cater for my graduation party :)

This is the best BBQ around in Arizona! I'm from Texas and tried a lot of places and was very disappointed UNTIL I came here!! It felt like I was at home again veryyyy delicious BBQ.i had the BBQ chicken and ribs with potato salad & cheesy potatoes.Very good prices and nice friendly staff!

Love this place. I met my girlfriends there last week for lunch, I had the baked potatoe with everything. Was not disappoint. They are hugh and tasty. If you have not been,try it. Very casual. Cafeteria style. Choice of in or outside dining. 
Also try Bergies coffee next door north. Owned by some good people. If you love coffee, these folks know their stuff

This place is great for families and kids.  You can sit outside on the benches and it provides a fun and casual atmosphere.  The bbq is pretty good.  We go two BBQ platters and four sides and split among 3 people and the portions were perfect.  I would definitely come back.  The meat off the rib literally slides off and the meat is yummy.  We asked for no bones in the chicken and it was good, not too dry.  I appreciated how they didn't slather on the BBQ sauce too much.  The homemade root beer and lemonade are pretty good.  The mac and cheese is better than the cheesy potatoes.  The blueberry cheesecake was good too.

Pretty darn good. I had the 2 item Meat Platter with ribs and brisket, cheesy potatoes, Mac & cheese, cornbread and, of course, the homemade root beer.  Over all a good time. A kind of high school cafeteria atmosphere, buffet style service was ok. Could of maybe used a little more spice on everything. Overall a good experience. Probably won't go back though. It's too far from home. Rock!

Birthday Bash at Joe's was a success again!  As usual the food was 5 STARS !  Everyone had more than enough food and fun. 

Thank you to all the staff at Joe's.  You are Simply the Best ! !

This place is Excellent . The Pork ribs were amazing.The homemade bread was also excellent.

Great staff, super clean, great selections.... try the homemade soda as well.

I'd recommend this place to everyone from family dinner to going out with friends. The outdoor patio is perfect as well.

This place does BBQ right. Came here for my birthday and got $10 off my order. I got a full sandwich half brisket half pulled pork with a side of coleslaw and fries. The sandwich was so good the meat was hot and juicy and covered in barbecue sauce which I got extra of. I was so full afterwards this is definitely a spot I'm going to visit again over and over. Next time getting the ribs.

we have been going to Joe's Real BBQ for many years.Now that I can't eat a lot of
food,as a senior and medical issues I asked for the Kids portion and was told I had to be under 12 and the girl refused to give me the Kids portion.This is very bad for Bussiness.
there were 6 other people with us so it was not like I just walked in alone..
There are to many other Restaurants here in Gilbert to go to and will accommodate
you..and more coming in....

My mind has been changed about this place, upgrading my last reviews.  I guess 3rd time is the charm, but the pulled pork "jumbo" sandwich and sides were amazing this time around.  I had the mac and cheese (love the crust) and the potatoes were perfect.  Everyone else in the group loved what they got too and had no complaints.  It is pricey for having to serve yourself, but I guess I don't mind as much when its this damn good!

I do have to say the BBQ is great, love the sauces, great kick. the cheesy potato's are really good. Now the lemon cake I have to say is the best I have ever had. Love the inside decor and being able to go outside and eat is a plus. Great job to the staff of Joe's

Average is all I can say. What was so special? My husband and I have been fans of the owners other establishments and with witnessing the line to this place finally decided to wait an hour to taste the food. Really is nothing amazing, it was like I said just average.

I was very unimpressed when I visited Joe's Real BBQ, the brisket was dry and tasteless and the root beer was bland. I complained to the manager (whom I believe was named Rose) and was met with awkward customer service and no resolution to my dilemma! Will not be recommending this place to any of my friends nor will I be back!

I eat a lot of BBQ and i really like this place. Great atmosphere. The strong point for this place is the sides. They are really well done. Got the ribs and brisket. Ribs were great; the only complaint is the brisket was a little tough, but not bad. It did have a nice smoke ring as well. I would eat here again. The service was fast and good as well.

I had passed Joe's a couple of times back in college but never really had the urge to come as it was so far away from where I lived and downtown Gilbert was not as poppin as it is today. Since moving to Chandler, I had been itching to try their fresh BBQ food and decided to come with family who were in town for a visit.

The funny thing about this place that I can't get over is the insane line on the inside of the restaurant and the wait times people put up with to order from inside. Seriously people, there's an express to-go section outside that has little to no line and you get your food soooo much faster! Still want to eat there and not take it to go? That's fine, they have no problem with you staying to enjoy your meal! The only difference is paper bag/wrap vs. being on a plate, which I could care less about. If the food is good, that's all that matters.

I ordered the jumbo sandwich which included chopped brisket/pulled pork and a side of potato salad. I have been to other BBQ establishments in CA and AZ but nobody does it quite like these guys. The meat is juicy and easy to eat--not too chewy but also not hard & dry. Their fresh homemade root beer and lemonade are also super delicious!

If you're into BBQ and are in the near vicinity of downtown Gilbert, get on down to Joe's Real BBQ!

Best BBQ I have had by far and the homemade root beer is amazing. I'll definitely be coming back. Friendly staff also. Relaxing atmosphere and old style feel. Awesome overall experience. If you happen to be in Gilbert Arizona definitely don't forget to stop by this place.

The food was delicious. The best Mac and Cheese. Cafeteria style good service. Very friendly staff. Say hi to Donald, he's there to help you decided. Don't forget to try the homemade root beer, some of the best I've ever had.

All too often people who own restaurants focus on the main entree or " center of the plate" and give little attention to the side dishes which are usually okay but an afterthought. 
This is not the case here. Even the slice of bread given is a rye/pepper? Bread that looks as though it is made especially for this business. Not the usual roll or store bought Texas toast. They also have cornbread but I didn't have it. The baked beans? Several different types of beans, meat and sauce. Delicious. Potato salad with seasoning which raises an eyebrow because it taste good but the average person won't be able to guess how it's made. The flavor unique to this business. I've also had the mac and cheese which was great. 
The HOMEMADE ROOT BEER is the best I've ever had anywhere. Even better than Virgils Root Beer. I don't drink any soda other than root beer, birch beer or sarsaparilla and I've tried practically every brand made everywhere I've travelled. I'm 60 now and maybe my memory is bad but it is reminiscent of the OLD A&W Root Beer Stands of the 1960's. Before the advent of high fructose corn syrup in beverages. 
Omg I almost forgot the entrees. After all this; do I have to go on?  The sauce is good. The entrees supported by the sides. It's just BBQ? Ha!!! Moist and delicious. I've had the ribs, bone in chicken, pulled pork which were all good. 
So why 4 and not 5 STARS? Bc it's still just BBQ but well managed, well prepared and well served. I'm glad it's in my neighborhood. 

Ok... I raved.... now a little rant.... On my last visit I noticed that the bags and kitchen crew were wearing.....FOR THE FIRST TIME IVE SEEN..... Joe's Farm Grill and not Joe's Real BBQ..... I totally dislike Joe's Farm Grille quality and service. SO.... if this is indicative of a change or if they've consolidated I'm deducting stars. First... the bread I raved about and the attention to detail? I got a generic white roll. My chicken was so dry I couldn't eat it. Threw it out. My sides were cold.  I will not return. Either there was a change in ownership, management, philosophy or whatever..... the fact that I now associate this horrible experience with a place I totally dislike means I won't give them another chance. It was that bad. My guess.... a change in management to maximize profitability at the cost of quality. Big mistake. If it ain't broke..... I know owners and chefs with big egos who think they can do something better. Sad.... read my review that is like falling off the cliff.

Wow, very disappointed. Ordered the sampler plate like I always do and when I got home and opened it up, like half the Briscuit and half the pulled pork I usually get. To me I would rather pay more for the same amount. Very sad. $14.00

Excellent, excellent, excellent. Joe's BBQ gets it right. The menu options are classic- smoked brisket, chicken breast, pulled pork, ham, sausage, and turkey. The sides include mac n' cheese, baked beans, potato salad, cheesy potatoes, and fries. You can select from sandwiches or plates with your choice of 1 or 2 meats. Trust me, the food is delicious. Folks come from all over the valley to eat at Joe's. There are 2 types of BBQ sauce: regular (sweeter) and spicy. Both are delicious, it's worth trying them. There's also a relish stand to grab whatever you'd like to compliment your food.

The setup is what you'd expect from a BBQ restaurant- open seating (indoors and out, with a pretty nice setup for outdoor dining when the weather cools down), cafeteria-style ordering, and a country feel to the establishment. Expect to wait during the busier times (weekends, lunches, holidays) as this place can get pretty popular. If you don't want to wait, there's a take-out order window on the side of the building- call ahead to place your order and swing by to pay for and pick-up your food. It's a very customer friendly service.

The service is good, not great. The restaurant is clean every time I've been there- plenty of booths or tables to choose from inside. Joe is a pretty established restauranteur in the Gilbert area (Farm Grill, Liberty Market Cafe, etc.) so he knows what patrons like and seems to attract good crowds. Joe's is no exception- it's great for families and kids. The food is very, very well done- but a bit pricey- be prepared to pay at least $10-12 per adult but the portions are pretty big.

This place is consistently good and very well priced. They have a room outside if you have a large crowd so if you wanted to meet for dinner with your  group, friends it accommodates about 50. Delicious barbecue and the sides are outstanding. Been here lots of times. Thanks Joe you lead the way.

Great BBQ joint

Some of the best barbecue I've ever had and great ambiance. Plenty to choose from and a great staff

Pulled pork sandwich with a side of potato salad. This is the meal I feel that BBQ places just can't screw up, which makes it my go-to order whenever I see it offered. If Joe's had onion rings, I would have gotten those too.
